15	ch000749	5	Missing Microsoft Windows .dll files	Recently installed program .  If you have recently installed a program and after the installation began encountering your .dll error messages, we suggest you first check if updates are available for the program. In some situations, a program may need to be updated for it to work properly on your computer. Updates are often found through the developer's website . If no updates are available for the program, try uninstalling the program to resolve the issue. If this does correct your issue, we suggest you contact the developer of the program for additional support on getting the program installed on the computer without it causing errors.	recently install program .#@#if you have recently install a program and after the installation begin encounter you .#@#dll error message , we suggest you first check if update be available for the program .#@#in some situation , a program may need to be update for it to work properly on you computer .#@#update be often find through the developer 's website .#@#if no update be available for the program , try uninstall the program to resolve the issue .#@#if this do correct you issue , we suggest you contact the developer of the program for additional support on get the program install on the computer without it cause error . 15	ch000749	7	Missing Microsoft Windows .dll files	Windows .dll error message or .dll errors when trying to do something within Windows and not a program .  Microsoft Windows .dll errors or .dll error messages that occur when starting Windows or trying to do something within Windows, such as opening the Control Panel, can be more serious and unfortunately more difficult to resolve. For these errors we suggest you run through the basic troubleshooting steps for your operating system . If running through these steps you encounter the same issues to resolve your .dll errors, we suggest you erase everything and reinstall Windows . If issues continue after windows has been reinstalled or errors occur during the installation of Windows, it's possible that you may have a hardware issue that is the cause of all your problems. 16	ch000138	0	How do I fix illegal operations?	TSR's or Third-party programs .  TSR's or Third-party programs running in the background are one of the more commonly found reasons for Illegal Operations. If you are receiving an Illegal Operation when attempting to run a game or program it is recommend that you temporarily remove or disable programs running and TSR's running in the background, ensuring that these programs are not causing your issues. How to remove TSRs and startup programs. If, after removing these programs, you run the program or game and no longer receive the Illegal Operations, it is recommend that you reboot the computer and disable or End Task each program or TSR one at a time to attempt to determine what program is causing the Illegal Operation.	tsr 's or third-party program .#@#tsr 's or third-party program run in the background be one of the more commonly find reason for Illegal Operations .#@#if you be receive a illegal operation when attempt to run a game or program it be recommend that you temporarily remove or disable program run and tsr 's run in the background , ensure that these program be not cause you issue .#@#how to remove tsr and startup program .#@#if , after remove these program , you run the program or game and no longer receive the Illegal Operations , it be recommend that you reboot the computer and disable or end Task each program or tsr one at a time to attempt to determine what program be cause the Illegal Operation . 16	ch000138	1	How do I fix illegal operations?	Data not being read properly from source .  When running a program or game from a CD you receive an Illegal Operation, verify that the CD is clean. Additional information on how to clean a CD or CD-ROM drive can be found on our Cleaning Page . If you are running a game from a floppy diskette or other floppy media such as a zip diskette or LS120, verify that the diskette does not have physical errors with it by running a ScanDisk or a disk drive utility included with the drive.	datum not be read properly from source .#@#when run a program or game from a CD you receive a illegal operation , verify that the CD be clean .#@#additional information on how to clean a cd or cd-rom drive can be find on we Cleaning Page .#@#if you be run a game from a floppy diskette or other floppy media such as a zip diskette or ls120 , verify that the diskette do not have physical error with it by run a ScanDisk or a disk drive utility include with the drive . 16	ch000138	2	How do I fix illegal operations?	Installing a program or game on a hard drive that has errors or is highly fragmented .  When installing a program or game onto a hard drive it is recommended if you receive errors after installing that program or game that you uninstall that program or game, run a ScanDisk, then a defrag, and finally install the program or game again. If errors exist on the hard drive, they will cause the program or game to run improperly and can cause Illegal Operations. Microsoft ScanDisk help page . Microsoft Defrag help page .	install a program or game on a hard drive that have error or be highly fragmented .#@#when install a program or game onto a hard drive it be recommend if you receive error after install that program or game that you uninstall that program or game , run a ScanDisk , then a defrag , and finally install the program or game again .#@#if error exist on the hard drive , they will cause the program or game to run improperly and can cause Illegal Operations .#@#Microsoft ScanDisk help page .#@#Microsoft Defrag help page . 16	ch000138	3	How do I fix illegal operations?	Corrupt files .  Corrupt, bad or missing files can cause Illegal Operations. It is recommended that you uninstall or reinstall the program causing the Illegal Operation to verify that any corrupt, bad or missing files are replaced or repaired during the reinstallation.	Corrupt file .#@#Corrupt , bad or missing file can cause Illegal Operations .#@#it be recommend that you uninstall or reinstall the program cause the illegal operation to verify that any corrupt , bad or missing file be replace or repair during the reinstallation . 16	ch000138	4	How do I fix illegal operations?	Memory managers .  If you are running a memory manager that is used to obtain more memory or handle the computer memory in replace of Windows, it is recommended you temporarily disable or uninstall this program to verify it is not the memory manager causing the Illegal Operations.	memory manager .#@#if you be run a memory manager that be use to obtain more memory or handle the computer memory in replace of Windows , it be recommend you temporarily disable or uninstall this program to verify it be not the memory manager cause the Illegal Operations . 16	ch000138	5	How do I fix illegal operations?	Bad, incorrect or not the latest video drivers .  Bad, incorrect or not the latest video drivers may cause Illegal Operations when performing such tasks as moving the mouse or dragging data from one source to another as high demands are placed onto the video card. Decrease the video settings to at least 800 x 600, 256 colors to verify if the program or game being run is having errors because of the current video settings. How to set the resolution in Microsoft Windows? How to set the resolution or change the resolution/adapter in Windows 3.x. If, after attempting to adjust the video settings, you still encounter the same issue, verify the computer is utilizing the latest video card drivers by visiting our computer video drivers section .	bad , incorrect or not the latest video driver .#@#bad , incorrect or not the latest video driver may cause Illegal Operations when perform such task as move the mouse or drag datum from one source to another as high demand be place onto the video card .#@#decrease the video setting to at least 800 x 600 , 256 color to verify if the program or game be run be have error because of the current video setting .#@#how to set the resolution in Microsoft Windows ?#@#how to set the resolution or change the resolution/adapter in Windows 3 .#@#x. if , after attempt to adjust the video setting , you still encounter the same issue , verify the computer be utilize the latest video card driver by visit we computer video driver section . 16	ch000138	6	How do I fix illegal operations?	Computer Virus .  Because computer viruses are loaded into memory and can change the data of program files when infecting a computer, ensure that a virus protection utility is installed on the computer and that you have the latest Virus Definition. Additional information about computer Viruses can be found at our Virus page .	computer virus .#@#because computer virus be load into memory and can change the datum of program file when infect a computer , ensure that a virus protection utility be install on the computer and that you have the latest virus definition .#@#additional information about computer virus can be find at we virus page . 16	ch000138	7	How do I fix illegal operations?	Added hardware .  If added hardware has been recently installed onto the computer it is likely that either the hardware is conflicting with other hardware devices on the computer or that the drivers used to install that hardware is causing issues with other hardware or software installed on the computer. If added hardware has recently been added to the computer, it is recommended that you temporarily remove that added hardware and the software associated with it to ensure it is not causing your issues.	add hardware .#@#if add hardware have be recently install onto the computer it be likely that either the hardware be conflict with other hardware device on the computer or that the driver use to install that hardware be cause issue with other hardware or software install on the computer .#@#if add hardware have recently be add to the computer , it be recommend that you temporarily remove that add hardware and the software associate with it to ensure it be not cause you issue . 16	ch000138	8	How do I fix illegal operations?	Error in program coding .  If you are receiving Illegal Operations only when running a particular program, verify that the program is compatible with the Version of Windows you are running and ensure no available patches or software are available that may fix errors made during the development stages.	error in program coding .#@#if you be receive Illegal Operations only when run a particular program , verify that the program be compatible with the Version of Windows you be run and ensure no available patch or software be available that may fix error make during the development stage . 16	ch000138	9	How do I fix illegal operations?	Corruption or problem within Windows .  Because Windows controls the memory operations as well as the file structure and association, it is possible for Windows or files associated with Windows to become corrupted, causing Illegal Operations or other errors. It is recommended you reinstall Windows if you are experiencing Illegal Operations in Windows or more than one program trying to be run on the computer.	Corruption or problem within Windows .#@#because Windows control the memory operation as well as the file structure and association , it be possible for Windows or file associate with Windows to become corrupted , cause Illegal Operations or other error .#@#it be recommend you reinstall Windows if you be experience Illegal Operations in Windows or more than one program try to be run on the computer . 16	ch000138	10	How do I fix illegal operations?	Bad Memory, invalid bits or physically bad memory .  It is possible that bad memory can cause Illegal Operations. If you have recently added memory to the computer, it is recommended that it first be removed to verify that you are not experiencing conflicts with the recently installed memory. If no memory has been recently added to the computer and you have tried all the above recommendations test your computer memory. How can I test my memory to determine if it is bad?	bad memory , invalid bit or physically bad memory .#@#it be possible that bad memory can cause Illegal Operations .#@#if you have recently add memory to the computer , it be recommend that it first be remove to verify that you be not experience conflict with the recently install memory .#@#if no memory have be recently add to the computer and you have try all the above recommendation test you computer memory .#@#how can I test my memory to determine if it be bad ? 17	ch000224	3	How to fix a general protection fault	Verify your computer has more than 200 MB available .  If your computer is running low on hard drive space, your Windows Swap File will be unable to increase in size when needed, causing programs to be swapped between memory and the hard drive more frequently. When this occurs it is more likely that a GPF can occur. Determining available hard drive space.	verify you computer have more than 200 mb available .#@#if you computer be run low on hard drive space , you Windows Swap File will be unable to increase in size when need , cause program to be swap between memory and the hard drive more frequently .#@#when this occur it be more likely that a gpf can occur .#@#determine available hard drive space . 17	ch000224	5	How to fix a general protection fault	Disable external cache .  If your CPU utilizes external cache disable it temporarily to verify if it is causing your GPF error messages. If available, you will be able to disable your external cache through CMOS Setup . If this resolves your issue it is recommended that you contact your computer, motherboard, or CPU manufacturer for additional recommendations or BIOS updates that may resolve your issue.	disable external cache .#@#if you CPU utilize external cache disable it temporarily to verify if it be cause you gpf error message .#@#if available , you will be able to disable you external cache through CMOS Setup .#@#if this resolve you issue it be recommend that you contact you computer , motherboard , or CPU manufacturer for additional recommendation or bio update that may resolve you issue . 17	ch000224	6	How to fix a general protection fault	Disable Power Management and screen savers .  If you are receiving GPFs when away from the computer or during durations when your computer is inactive, disable Power Management and screen savers to ensure that they are not causing your issue. 17	ch000224	8	How to fix a general protection fault	Bad memory or other bad hardware . 18	ch000528	0	Regaining computer hard drive space	Microsoft Windows 98, ME, 2000, XP, Vista and 7 users .  Run the Disk Cleanup option .  Open My Computer . Right-click on the hard drive that you wish to regain hard drive space. For example, right-click on the C: drive. Click Properties. Within the General tab , click the "Disk Cleanup" button located next to the pie chart . Windows will scan the computer for all files available to clean up. Once in the Disk Cleanup window check each of the boxes (except "compress old files") that are taking disk space and click Ok and then Yes if you wish to proceed. Compress? When performing a Disk Cleanup you'll have an option to compress your hard drive. We strongly recommend users do not compress their hard drive or compress their old files. Uninstall old programs or games no longer used .  Uninstalling Windows software. Disable System Restore .  Windows XP, Vista, and 7 users can also decrease the default space utilized by Windows System Restore and often gain several additional gigabytes of hard drive space. See the below steps in customizing this feature. Click Start, Programs, Accessories, System Tools, and open System Restore . Within the System Restore window, click System Restore Settings . Within the System Restore tab you can either check the Turn off System Restore on all drives to completely disable this feature, or click the Settings button and decrease the space usage, which is what we would recommend. Additional suggestion for Windows 2000 and Windows XP users: Window 2000 and Windows XP keeps all the necessary files needed to uninstall any of the updates ever installed on your computer. Often this is several dozen updates that can take up several hundred and sometimes over 1 gig of space on your hard drive. What are the $NtUninstallKBxxxxxx$ folders in Windows? Disable hibernation .  If you turn your computer off instead of using hibernation mode you can disable this feature to free up a lot of disk space. How do I disable hibernation mode in Windows? 18	ch000528	1	Regaining computer hard drive space	Microsoft Windows 95 users .  Users can regain computer hard drive space by performing any or all of the below steps. Clean up temporary files .  Click Start and then Search or Find .  In the "File type" text field type: *.tmp and verify the computer is looking at the C: drive or the drive that contains your operating system. Search for files and delete each of the temporary files that are found. Delete chk files .  Perform the same steps as number one except search for *.chk and delete any of the files that are found. Uninstall old programs or games no longer used .  Uninstalling Windows software. 18	ch000528	2	Regaining computer hard drive space	MS-DOS and Windows 3.x users .  Users can regain computer hard drive space by performing any or all of the below steps. From the MS-DOS prompt, type del *.tmp /s and del *.chk /s . This command will delete any temporary files or scandisk error files on the hard drive. Delete any software programs or games you are no longer using from MS-DOS or from Windows. See the del command and deltree command pages for further information about each of these commands.	ms-do and Windows 3 .#@#x user .#@#user can regain computer hard drive space by perform any or all of the below step .#@#from the ms-do prompt , type del * .#@#tmp / s and del * .#@#chk / s .#@#this command will delete any temporary file or scandisk error file on the hard drive .#@#delete any software program or game you be no longer use from ms-do or from Windows .#@#see the del command and deltree command page for further information about each of these command . 19	ch000248	0	General printer troubleshooting	Printer does not have power indicator .  First, make sure that the printer is on. When a printer is on it should have some light (usually green) indicating it's receiving power and is on. If you do not have any indicator light make sure the printer is connected to a working power outlet by verifying each end of the power cable. Next, press the printer power button. If after following the above steps your printer still cannot get a power status indicator it's likely you're encountering a serious printer issue and we suggest contacting the printer manufacturer for additional steps and instructions on repair or replacement.	printer do not have power indicator .#@#first , make sure that the printer be on .#@#when a printer be on it should have some light -lrb- usually green -rrb- indicate it be receive power and be on .#@#if you do not have any indicator light make sure the printer be connect to a work power outlet by verify each end of the power cable .#@#next , press the printer power button .#@#if after follow the above step you printer still can not get a power status indicator it be likely you be encounter a serious printer issue and we suggest contact the printer manufacturer for additional step and instruction on repair or replacement . 19	ch000248	1	General printer troubleshooting	Cables not connected properly .  Your printer should have two cables connected to it. The power cable and the data cable, the power cable should have already been verified as being connected if your printer has a power indicator light as mentioned above. Make sure the data cable ( parallel cable or USB cable) is also connected from the printer to the computer.	cable not connect properly .#@#you printer should have two cable connect to it .#@#the power cable and the datum cable , the power cable should have already be verify as be connect if you printer have a power indicator light as mention above .#@#make sure the datum cable -lrb- parallel cable or usb cable -rrb- be also connect from the printer to the computer . 19	ch000248	2	General printer troubleshooting	Printer error (orange or blinking light) After your printer has completed its initial startup you should have a solid green light. If the light indicator is blinking or orange often this is an indication of a printer error. For example, this could indicate a paper jam, issue with the ink or toner cartridge, or other serious error. Because there is no standard to what a blinking light or orange light means if you're getting either of these we suggest referring to the printer documentation for troubleshooting steps or methods of determining what the status indicator is reporting.	printer error -lrb- orange or blinking light -rrb- after you printer have complete its initial startup you should have a solid green light .#@#if the light indicator be blinking or orange often this be a indication of a printer error .#@#for example , this could indicate a paper jam , issue with the ink or toner cartridge , or other serious error .#@#because there be no standard to what a blinking light or orange light means if you be get either of these we suggest refer to the printer documentation for troubleshoot step or method of determine what the status indicator be report .	NN NN -LRB- NN CC RB JJ -RRB- IN PRP$ NN VBZ VBN PRP$ JJ NN PRP MD VB DT JJ JJ NN .#@#IN DT JJ NN VBZ RB CC NN RB DT VBZ DT NN IN DT NN NN .#@#IN NN , DT MD VB DT NN NN , NN IN DT NN CC NN NN , CC JJ JJ NN .#@#IN EX VBZ DT NN TO WP DT RB JJ CC JJ JJ NNS IN PRP VBP VBG DT IN DT PRP VBP VBG TO DT NN NN IN VBG NNS CC NNS IN VBG WP DT NN NN VBZ VBG .	(ROOT (S (NP (NP (NN Printer) (NN error)) (PRN (-LRB- -LRB-) (NP (NP (NN orange)) (CC or) (NP (RB blinking) (JJ light))) (-RRB- -RRB-))) (PP (IN After) (NP (PRP$ your) (NN printer))) (VP (VBZ has) (VP (VBN completed) (NP (NP (PRP$ its) (JJ initial) (NN startup)) (SBAR (S (NP (PRP you)) (VP (MD should) (VP (VB have) (NP (DT a) (JJ solid) (JJ green) (NN light))))))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (SBAR (IN If) (S (NP (DT the) (JJ light) (NN indicator)) (VP (VP (VBZ is) (RB blinking)) (CC or) (VP (NP (NN orange)) (ADVP (RB often)))))) (NP (DT this)) (VP (VBZ is) (NP (NP (DT an) (NN indication)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT a) (NN printer) (NN error))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (PP (IN For) (NP (NN example))) (, ,) (NP (DT this)) (VP (MD could) (VP (VB indicate) (NP (NP (DT a) (NN paper) (NN jam)) (, ,) (NP (NP (NN issue)) (PP (IN with) (NP (DT the) (NP (NN ink) (CC or) (NN toner)) (NN cartridge)))) (, ,) (CC or) (NP (JJ other) (JJ serious) (NN error))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (SBAR (IN Because) (S (NP (EX there)) 19	ch000248	3	General printer troubleshooting	No paper or paper jam .  Without paper your printer will not be able to print. Make sure you have paper in the paper loaded into the printer paper cartridge or tray. Next, verify that no printer paper is jammed or partially fed into the printer. If you have one or more pieces of paper stuck in the printer these will need to be manually removed before the printer will print again.	no paper or paper jam .#@#without paper you printer will not be able to print .#@#make sure you have paper in the paper load into the printer paper cartridge or tray .#@#next , verify that no printer paper be jam or partially feed into the printer .#@#if you have one or more piece of paper stick in the printer these will need to be manually remove before the printer will print again . 19	ch000248	4	General printer troubleshooting	Inkjet printer ink related issues .  Often when you're encountering an ink related issue you're printer status indicator light (mentioned above) should be flashing. If this is not occurring you may want to skip to the next section. However, if you've recently inserted a new ink cartridge you may want to try the below suggestions. Replacing ink cartridges and printer not working. 19	ch000248	5	General printer troubleshooting	Printer self tests .  Most printers have a way of printing a test page. This page allows you to determine if the printer is physically working or not. This test is usually accomplished by holding down a series of keys. If you are not sure if your printer has this feature or how to perform it refer to your manual or visit your printer manufacturers web site . In addition to testing the printer using the printer self-test Microsoft Windows users can also perform a software self-test to determine if their computer is able to see the printer and it's able to print. Follow the below steps to perform this test. Microsoft Windows 98, 2000, ME, XP, 2003, and Vista users .  Click Start , Settings, and open Control Panel . Double-click the Printers or Printers and Fax icon. Right-click on the Printer you wish to test and click Properties. If you do not see your printer listed your printer is not installed. In the Printers Properties window click the Print Test Page button . If the printer is able to print a test page, you're printer is installed and setup properly. However, if you're unable to print in other programs it's possible that the program you're attempting to print from has issues. Older versions of Windows with older printers .  If you are running an older printer and MS-DOS , Windows 3.x , Windows 95 , Windows 98 , or Windows NT , you can also attempt the below software test. Get to a MS-DOS prompt or Windows command line .  Get to the root directory - Type: cd\ Reroute dir to printer - Type: dir > lpt1 .  The above should take the directory listing and print to the printer. If this does not print, refer to your operating system troubleshooting section. Extra Note: This will not paper feed, therefore press your FF or PP, or manually eject the paper.	printer self test .#@#most printer have a way of print a test page .#@#this page allow you to determine if the printer be physically work or not .#@#this test be usually accomplish by hold down a series of key .#@#if you be not sure if you printer have this feature or how to perform it refer to you manual or visit you printer manufacturer web site .#@#in addition to test the printer use the printer self-test Microsoft Windows user can also perform a software self-test to determine if they computer be able to see the printer and it be able to print .#@#follow the below step to perform this test .#@#Microsoft Windows 98 , 2000 , me , xp , 2003 , and Vista user .#@#click Start , Settings , and open control panel .#@#double-click the Printers or Printers and Fax icon .#@#right-click on the Printer you wish to test and click Properties .#@#if you do not see you printer list you printer be not install .#@#in the Printers Properties window click the print test Page button .#@#if the printer be able to print a test page , you be printer be install and setup properly .#@#however , if you be unable to print in other program it be possible that the program you be attempt to print from have issue .#@#older version of Windows with older printer .#@#if you be run a older printer and ms-do , Windows 3 .#@#x , Windows 95 , Windows 98 , or Windows NT , you can also attempt the below software test .#@#get to a ms-do prompt or Windows command line .#@#get to the root directory - type : cd \ Reroute dir to printer - type : dir > lpt1 .#@#the above should take the directory listing and print to the printer .#@#if this do not print , refer to you operating system troubleshoot section .#@#Extra note : this will not paper feed , therefore press you ff or pp , or manually eject the paper . 19	ch000248	6	General printer troubleshooting	Printer drivers .  If your printer does not have any flashing lights and is connected properly it's possible you may be encountering a driver related issue. We suggest visiting our printer driver listing , which links to all major printer manufacturer driver pages and downloading the latest printer drivers for your printer.	printer driver .#@#if you printer do not have any flash light and be connect properly it be possible you may be encounter a driver related issue .#@#we suggest visit we printer driver listing , which link to all major printer manufacturer driver page and download the latest printer driver for you printer . 19	ch000248	7	General printer troubleshooting	Parallel (LPT) printers .  If the printer you're connecting to the computer is an LPT (parallel port) printer we also suggest verifying the below suggestions if your printer is not working. Parallel port in CMOS .  Enter the computers CMOS setup . Once in CMOS verify that your parallel port is enabled or installed . Next, verify the printer or parallel port mode. This option will often have several different modes. If your parallel port is set to ECP mode, we suggest trying a different mode. Other parallel device .  If you have a parallel printer with other parallel devices such as a parallel scanner or zip drive, temporarily disconnect these devices to verify they are not causing your issue.	parallel -lrb- lpt -rrb- printer .#@#if the printer you be connect to the computer be a lpt -lrb- parallel port -rrb- printer we also suggest verify the below suggestion if you printer be not work .#@#parallel port in CMOS .#@#enter the computer cmo setup .#@#once in cmo verify that you parallel port be enable or install .#@#next , verify the printer or parallel port mode .#@#this option will often have several different mode .#@#if you parallel port be set to ecp mode , we suggest try a different mode .#@#other parallel device .#@#if you have a parallel printer with other parallel device such as a parallel scanner or zip drive , temporarily disconnect these device to verify they be not cause you issue .	JJ -LRB- NN -RRB- NNS .#@#IN DT NN PRP VBP VBG TO DT NN VBZ DT NN -LRB- JJ NN -RRB- NN PRP RB VBP VBG DT IN NNS IN PRP$ NN VBZ RB VBG .#@#JJ NN IN NNP .#@#VB DT NNS NNS NN .#@#RB IN NNS VBP IN PRP$ NN NN VBZ VBN CC VBN .#@#RB , VB DT NN CC JJ NN NN .#@#DT NN MD RB VB JJ JJ NNS .#@#IN PRP$ NN NN VBZ VBN TO NN NN , PRP VBP VBG DT JJ NN .#@#JJ JJ NN .#@#IN PRP VBP DT JJ NN IN JJ JJ NNS JJ IN DT JJ NN CC NN NN , RB VB DT NNS TO VB PRP VBP RB VBG PRP$ NN .	(ROOT (NP (NP (JJ Parallel) (-LRB- -LRB-) (NN LPT) (-RRB- -RRB-)) (NP (NNS printers)) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (SBAR (IN If) (S (NP (NP (DT the) (NN printer)) (SBAR (S (NP (PRP you)) (VP (VBP 're) (VP (VBG connecting) (PP (TO to) (NP (DT the) (NN computer)))))))) (VP (VBZ is) (NP (DT an) (NN LPT) (PRN (-LRB- -LRB-) (NP (JJ parallel) (NN port)) (-RRB- -RRB-)) (NN printer))))) (NP (PRP we)) (ADVP (RB also)) (VP (VBP suggest) (S (VP (VBG verifying) (NP (NP (DT the) (ADVP (IN below)) (NNS suggestions)) (SBAR (IN if) (S (NP (PRP$ your) (NN printer)) (VP (VBZ is) (RB not) (VP (VBG working))))))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (NP (NP (JJ Parallel) (NN port)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NNP CMOS))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (VP (VB Enter) (NP (DT the) (NNS computers) (NNS CMOS) (NN setup))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (SBAR (RB Once) (IN in) (S (NP (NNS CMOS)) (VP (VBP verify) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (PRP$ your) (NN parallel) (NN port)) (VP (VBZ is) (VP (VBN enabled) (CC or) (VBN installed))))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (ADVP (RB Next)) (, 20	ch000689	0	Computer turns off without warning	Heat related issue .  A computer that turns off without warning is usually caused by a heat related issue. Many computers today are designed to turn off automatically if the computer, processor, or other device gets too hot. Start by verifying the fan on the power supply is working by examining the back of the computer and seeing if the fan is moving and moving smoothly. For all other fans in the computer, you will need to open the computer and make sure the fan are working. While in the computer example the processor fan ( heatsink ), video card fans, and case fans . If you have heard any abnormal noises coming from your computer recently such as a high squealing, this is also a common indication of a fan failure. Tip: While inside the computer it may also be a good idea to clean the inside of the computer . Dust, dirt, hair, and other residue in the vents and on the fans can prevent proper air flow and heat the computer. Tip: If your BIOS monitors the RPM of the fans, enter BIOS and make sure the BIOS does not report any errors. Software utilities such as SpeedFan can also be used to help monitor fans in your computer. While inside the computer, it's also a good idea to verify the processor heatsink is properly connected by disconnecting and reconnecting the heatsink. If the processor heatsink is not properly attached or does not have a proper amount of thermal compound, the computer will overheat. Caution: If you do remove the processor heatsink the thermal compound on the processor and heatsink should be cleaned and new thermal compound should be applied. Not reapplying new thermal compound could make issues worse since the bond between the CPU and heatsink would be broken. Is there a way to tell how hot my CPU is running? What should be the temperature of my processor?	heat related issue .#@#a computer that turn off without warning be usually cause by a heat related issue .#@#many computer today be design to turn off automatically if the computer , processor , or other device get too hot .#@#Start by verify the fan on the power supply be work by examine the back of the computer and see if the fan be move and move smoothly .#@#for all other fan in the computer , you will need to open the computer and make sure the fan be work .#@#while in the computer example the processor fan -lrb- heatsink -rrb- , video card fan , and case fan .#@#if you have hear any abnormal noise come from you computer recently such as a high squealing , this be also a common indication of a fan failure .#@#tip : while inside the computer it may also be a good idea to clean the inside of the computer .#@#dust , dirt , hair , and other residue in the vent and on the fan can prevent proper air flow and heat the computer .#@#tip : if you bio monitor the rpm of the fan , enter bio and make sure the bio do not report any error .#@#Software utility such as SpeedFan can also be use to help monitor fan in you computer .#@#while inside the computer , it be also a good idea to verify the processor heatsink be properly connect by disconnect and reconnect the heatsink .#@#if the processor heatsink be not properly attach or do not have a proper amount of thermal compound , the computer will overheat .#@#caution : if you do remove the processor heatsink the thermal compound on the processor and heatsink should be clean and new thermal compound should be apply .#@#not reapply new thermal compound could make issue worse since the bond between the CPU and heatsink would be break .#@#be there a way to tell how hot my CPU be run ?#@#what should be the temperature of my processor ? 20	ch000689	1	Computer turns off without warning	Hardware issue or error .  Any failing hardware component in your computer could cause your computer to unexpectedly turn off without warning. If you have recently added any new hardware remove it from the computer to make sure it is not causing the problem. Tip: Before attempting to remove any hardware, make sure you are not encountering this issue because of hardware conflicts by checking Device Manager for errors . If you have not recently installed any new hardware into the computer, the next best solution to determining if this is a hardware issue would be remove any hardware on the computer that is not needed. For example, remove your modem, network card, sound card, and any other expansion cards that are not needed for the computer to operate. Run the computer without these cards to see if they are the cause of your issue.	hardware issue or error .#@#any fail hardware component in you computer could cause you computer to unexpectedly turn off without warning .#@#if you have recently add any new hardware remove it from the computer to make sure it be not cause the problem .#@#tip : before attempt to remove any hardware , make sure you be not encounter this issue because of hardware conflict by check Device Manager for error .#@#if you have not recently install any new hardware into the computer , the next best solution to determine if this be a hardware issue would be remove any hardware on the computer that be not need .#@#for example , remove you modem , network card , sound card , and any other expansion card that be not need for the computer to operate .#@#Run the computer without these card to see if they be the cause of you issue . 20	ch000689	2	Computer turns off without warning	Computer virus .  Although not as likely as the above reasons, it is possible for your computer to be infected with a virus that is designed to shut down your computer or turn it off. If your computer seems to be turning off when executing a certain program at specific times in the day, it could be infected. If you believe your computer may be infected with a virus or are uncertain if your computer is infected with a virus, make sure your virus scanner definitions are up-to-date and it may also be a good idea to scan the computer for any other malware .	computer virus .#@#although not as likely as the above reason , it be possible for you computer to be infect with a virus that be design to shut down you computer or turn it off .#@#if you computer seem to be turn off when execute a certain program at specific time in the day , it could be infect .#@#if you believe you computer may be infect with a virus or be uncertain if you computer be infect with a virus , make sure you virus scanner definition be up-to-date and it may also be a good idea to scan the computer for any other malware . 20	ch000689	3	Computer turns off without warning	Issue with operating system .  If after following each of the above recommendations your computer still continues to reboot, it is likely that you are experiencing a Microsoft Windows operating system related issue that cannot be explained. To help make sure this is the case, try the below steps. Reboot the computer and enter CMOS setup as the computer is booting. After you have loaded the computer in CMOS setup, let the computer sit. If the computer does not turn off while letting the computer sit in CMOS, you are likely experiencing an issue with Microsoft Windows or your operating system and it is recommend you erase everything and reinstall Microsoft Windows .	issue with operate system .#@#if after follow each of the above recommendation you computer still continue to reboot , it be likely that you be experience a Microsoft Windows operate system related issue that can not be explain .#@#to help make sure this be the case , try the below step .#@#reboot the computer and enter cmo setup as the computer be boot .#@#after you have load the computer in CMOS setup , let the computer sit .#@#if the computer do not turn off while let the computer sit in CMOS , you be likely experience a issue with Microsoft Windows or you operating system and it be recommend you erase everything and reinstall Microsoft Windows . 20	ch000689	4	Computer turns off without warning	Other failing hardware .  If after reinstalling your operating system , or during the installation of your operating system, your computer turns off abnormally, it is very likely that other hardware is failing in the computer. Often this is RAM , CPU , Motherboard , Power Supply , or Video card (in that order). Steps on how to test your computer memory for errors. If you have extra parts or have a friend or co-worker with a similar configuration that is willing to allow you to test their hardware in your computer, try swapping these parts to determine if they are at fault. Otherwise, you will need to have the computer serviced.	other fail hardware .#@#if after reinstall you operating system , or during the installation of you operating system , you computer turn off abnormally , it be very likely that other hardware be fail in the computer .#@#often this be RAM , CPU , Motherboard , Power Supply , or Video card -lrb- in that order -rrb- .#@#step on how to test you computer memory for error .#@#if you have extra part or have a friend or co-worker with a similar configuration that be willing to allow you to test they hardware in you computer , try swap these part to determine if they be at fault .#@#otherwise , you will need to have the computer service . 21	ch000443	0	General scanner troubleshooting	Verify cables connected properly to the back of the scanner .  If the scanner is a parallel port scanner it is likely it has two available connections on the back of the scanner. 21	ch000443	1	General scanner troubleshooting	Ensure that the scanner is getting power .  If your scanner is not getting power it is recommended that you check the connections ensuring that they are connected properly to the back of the computer and from the scanner to the wall. If you have the scanner connected to a power strip or surge protector it is temporarily recommended that you connect the scanner directly to the wall. If the computer scanner is getting power, you should notice the inside light come on when the power is first received by the scanner. After checking the connections you still get no power to the scanner, it is recommended you contact the manufacturer of the scanner.	ensure that the scanner be get power .#@#if you scanner be not get power it be recommend that you check the connection ensure that they be connect properly to the back of the computer and from the scanner to the wall .#@#if you have the scanner connect to a power strip or surge protector it be temporarily recommend that you connect the scanner directly to the wall .#@#if the computer scanner be get power , you should notice the inside light come on when the power be first receive by the scanner .#@#after check the connection you still get no power to the scanner , it be recommend you contact the manufacturer of the scanner . 21	ch000443	2	General scanner troubleshooting	Additional parallel port scanner troubleshooting .  If you have another device connected in between the scanner and the computer, turn off the computer and temporally disconnect the devices connected to or from the scanner. If, after disconnecting these devices, the scanner works, it is likely that another device may have issues or may be unable to work with other parallel devices.	additional parallel port scanner troubleshooting .#@#if you have another device connect in between the scanner and the computer , turn off the computer and temporally disconnect the device connect to or from the scanner .#@#if , after disconnect these device , the scanner work , it be likely that another device may have issue or may be unable to work with other parallel device . 21	ch000443	3	General scanner troubleshooting	PC Windows users verify no TSRs are running in the background .  Press CTRL + ALT + DEL and end task all currently running software except explorer and Systray and scan again.  If this resolves your issue it's a possibility that an application in the background such as a virus utility is preventing your scanner from scanning.	pc Windows user verify no tsr be run in the background .#@#Press CTRL + ALT + DEL and end task all currently run software except explorer and Systray and scan again .#@#if this resolve you issue it be a possibility that a application in the background such as a virus utility be prevent you scanner from scanning . 22	ch000277	0	Basic floppy disk drive troubleshooting	Not setup in CMOS .  Verify that the floppy drive is properly setup in CMOS Setup . If the floppy drive is not setup properly you may experience read/write errors or the floppy may not work at all. Most computers need to have the floppy setup as a 3.5, 1.44MB.	not setup in CMOS .#@#verify that the floppy drive be properly setup in CMOS Setup .#@#if the floppy drive be not setup properly you may experience read/write error or the floppy may not work at all .#@#most computer need to have the floppy setup as a 3.5 , 1.44 mb . 22	ch000277	1	Basic floppy disk drive troubleshooting	Confliction with other hardware .  If you have recently physically installed any new hardware such as a tape drive or other backup medium, temporarily disconnect that new hardware to ensure that it is not the cause of your floppy drive not working.	confliction with other hardware .#@#if you have recently physically install any new hardware such as a tape drive or other backup medium , temporarily disconnect that new hardware to ensure that it be not the cause of you floppy drive not work .	NN IN JJ NN .#@#IN PRP VBP RB RB VBN DT JJ NN JJ IN DT NN NN CC JJ JJ NN , RB VB IN JJ NN TO VB IN PRP VBZ RB DT NN IN PRP$ JJ NN RB VBG .	(ROOT (NP (NP (NN Confliction)) (PP (IN with) (NP (JJ other) (NN hardware))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (SBAR (IN If) (S (NP (PRP you)) (VP (VBP have) (ADVP (RB recently) (RB physically)) (VP (VBN installed) (NP (NP (DT any) (JJ new) (NN hardware)) (PP (JJ such) (IN as) (NP (NP (DT a) (NN tape) (NN drive)) (CC or) (NP (JJ other) (JJ backup) (NN medium))))))))) (, ,) (ADVP (RB temporarily)) (VP (VB disconnect) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (JJ new) (NN hardware)) (VP (TO to) (VP (VB ensure) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (PRP it)) (VP (VBZ is) (RB not) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN cause)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (PRP$ your) (JJ floppy) (NN drive)) (ADJP (RB not) (VBG working))))))))))))) (. .)))	confliction with other hardware if you have recently physically install any new hardware such as a tape drive or other backup medium temporarily disconnect that new hardware to ensure that it be not the cause of you floppy drive not work
22	ch000277	2	Basic floppy disk drive troubleshooting	Not connected properly .  Power down, unplug, and open computer, being aware of ESD and its potential dangers. Verify that the floppy connection is connected to the motherboard FDD connector. If it appears to be connected, disconnect and reconnect cable to verify cable is seated properly. Verify that the floppy cable coming from the motherboard is connected to the back of the floppy drive. If connected, disconnect and connect the floppy drive cable to verify seated properly. Verify that a power connection is also connected to the back of the floppy drive. If your floppy cable has more than one connection, verify that you have connected the floppy to the appropriate connection. The above picture illustrates what drive should be connected where.	not connect properly .#@#power down , unplug , and open computer , be aware of esd and its potential danger .#@#verify that the floppy connection be connect to the motherboard fdd connector .#@#if it appear to be connect , disconnect and reconnect cable to verify cable be seat properly .#@#verify that the floppy cable come from the motherboard be connect to the back of the floppy drive .#@#if connect , disconnect and connect the floppy drive cable to verify seat properly .#@#verify that a power connection be also connect to the back of the floppy drive .#@#if you floppy cable have more than one connection , verify that you have connect the floppy to the appropriate connection .#@#the above picture illustrate what drive should be connect where . 22	ch000277	3	Basic floppy disk drive troubleshooting	Bad drivers .  If you are not able to read or write to a floppy diskette from Windows, verify that the computer is not exhibiting floppy drivers issues by testing the floppy drive from MS-DOS. If you are running Windows 3.x click File and click Exit Windows to get to an MS-DOS prompt. If you are running Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows ME, Windows NT, Windows 2000, or Windows 2000 click Start, Shutdown, and Restart the computer to a MS-DOS prompt. Once at the prompt, place a diskette into the floppy disk drive and type format a: if you get: Invalid media or Track 0 Bad = Try formatting another floppy disk. Write Protect Error = Ensure that the disk is not write protected by removing the floppy disk and insuring that you cannot see through both holes; if you can, move the tab in the left hand side down (looking from the back of the floppy) and try again. If the disk is not write protected try another floppy disk. Invalid drive specification = Verify that you floppy drive is setup properly in CMOS Setup . If the floppy disk drive formats properly in MS-DOS but does not format in Windows, it is likely that Windows or a program within Windows is preventing the floppy drive from working. End task all running TSRs and background programs . If you continue to experience the same issues we recommend that Windows be reinstalled.	bad driver .#@#if you be not able to read or write to a floppy diskette from Windows , verify that the computer be not exhibit floppy driver issue by test the floppy drive from ms-do .#@#if you be run Windows 3 .#@#x click File and click exit Windows to get to a ms-do prompt .#@#if you be run Windows 95 , Windows 98 , Windows ME , Windows NT , Windows 2000 , or Windows 2000 click Start , Shutdown , and restart the computer to a ms-do prompt .#@#once at the prompt , place a diskette into the floppy disk drive and type format a : if you get : invalid media or Track 0 bad = try formatting another floppy disk .#@#write Protect error = ensure that the disk be not write protect by remove the floppy disk and insure that you can not see through both hole ; if you can , move the tab in the left hand side down -lrb- look from the back of the floppy -rrb- and try again .#@#if the disk be not write protected try another floppy disk .#@#invalid drive specification = Verify that you floppy drive be setup properly in CMOS Setup .#@#if the floppy disk drive format properly in ms-do but do not format in Windows , it be likely that Windows or a program within Windows be prevent the floppy drive from work .#@#end task all run tsr and background program .#@#if you continue to experience the same issue we recommend that Windows be reinstall . 22	ch000277	4	Basic floppy disk drive troubleshooting	Bad hardware .  If you continue to experience issues after following the above steps it is likely that hardware within the computer is bad. Replace the following hardware in the computer in the below order. Replace the floppy data cable that connects the computer floppy drive to the motherboard \ I/O board. Replace the floppy if the floppy data cable did not resolve your issues. Replace or request that the motherboard \ I/O board be replaced.	bad hardware .#@#if you continue to experience issue after follow the above step it be likely that hardware within the computer be bad .#@#replace the follow hardware in the computer in the below order .#@#replace the floppy datum cable that connect the computer floppy drive to the motherboard \ i/o board .#@#replace the floppy if the floppy datum cable do not resolve you issue .#@#replace or request that the motherboard \ i/o board be replace . 23	ch001088	3	How can I test for hardware failures in my computer?	Computer power supply (PSU) Although there are programs such as speedfan to help monitor the voltage and power supplied to the fans in the computer there is no software utility to test the integrity of computer power supplies. There are methods of testing the power connectors on a power supply using a multimeter .  However, because of the potential damage that can be caused to the power supply, potentially the motherboard and other components connected to it, this information is not posted on Computer Hope. We suggest users who believe their power supply is failing or is already bad, replace it.	computer power supply -lrb- psu -rrb- although there be program such as speedfan to help monitor the voltage and power supply to the fan in the computer there be no software utility to test the integrity of computer power supplies .#@#there be method of test the power connector on a power supply use a multimeter .#@#however , because of the potential damage that can be cause to the power supply , potentially the motherboard and other component connect to it , this information be not post on computer Hope .#@#we suggest user who believe they power supply be fail or be already bad , replace it . 24	ch000254	0	Mouse not being detected or working in Windows	Computer frozen .  Make sure the computer is not frozen by pressing the num lock key on the keyboard. When pressing the num lock key the num lock indicator LED on your keyboard should turn on and off. If this indicator does not change, your computer is frozen, and all hardware on the computer including the mouse will not work. Reboot the computer to resolve this issue. Windows freezes or stops responding frequently.	computer frozen .#@#make sure the computer be not freeze by press the num lock key on the keyboard .#@#when press the num lock key the num lock indicator lead on you keyboard should turn on and off .#@#if this indicator do not change , you computer be freeze , and all hardware on the computer include the mouse will not work .#@#reboot the computer to resolve this issue .#@#Windows freeze or stop respond frequently . 24	ch000254	2	Mouse not being detected or working in Windows	Not connected properly .  If you are using a PS/2 mouse, verify that it is connected into the PS/2 mouse port and not the PS/2 keyboard port located on the back of the computer. If the mouse has worked properly in the past, turn off the computer and disconnect and reconnect the mouse. Note: A PS/2 mouse should not be disconnected and reconnected while the computer is still turned on. Tip: If the computer keyboard is working you can shutdown Windows properly by using the keyboard. Press the Windows key on the keyboard, and then use the arrow keys to move to the shut down option on the start menu. If you are using a USB mouse disconnect and reconnect the mouse cable to another USB port. If the mouse still does not work after it has been reconnected and is connected to a USB hub , connect the mouse to a USB port on the back of the computer.	not connect properly .#@#if you be use a PS/2 mouse , verify that it be connect into the PS/2 mouse port and not the PS/2 keyboard port located on the back of the computer .#@#if the mouse have work properly in the past , turn off the computer and disconnect and reconnect the mouse .#@#note : a PS/2 mouse should not be disconnect and reconnect while the computer be still turn on .#@#tip : if the computer keyboard be work you can shutdown Windows properly by use the keyboard .#@#Press the Windows key on the keyboard , and then use the arrow key to move to the shut down option on the start menu .#@#if you be use a usb mouse disconnect and reconnect the mouse cable to another usb port .#@#if the mouse still do not work after it have be reconnect and be connect to a usb hub , connect the mouse to a usb port on the back of the computer . 24	ch000254	3	Mouse not being detected or working in Windows	Mouse software or driver conflict .  Boot into Windows Safe Mode . If the mouse is working in Safe Mode, there is likely a driver conflict or other software conflict. To resolve this conflict follow the below steps. Open Windows Device Manager . Expand the mouse (mice) option in Device Manager by clicking the '+' symbol. Remove all mice listed by highlighting each device and pressing the delete key on the keyboard. If the mouse still does not work in Normal Windows, follow your operating system basic troubleshooting steps for your version of Windows.	mouse software or driver conflict .#@#boot into Windows Safe Mode .#@#if the mouse be work in Safe Mode , there be likely a driver conflict or other software conflict .#@#to resolve this conflict follow the below step .#@#open Windows Device Manager .#@#expand the mouse -lrb- mouse -rrb- option in Device Manager by click the ' + ' symbol .#@#remove all mouse list by highlight each device and press the delete key on the keyboard .#@#if the mouse still do not work in normal Windows , follow you operating system basic troubleshooting step for you version of Windows . 24	ch000254	4	Mouse not being detected or working in Windows	Bad Mouse .  If the above steps do not solve the problem, try another mouse. If the another mouse works, try the mouse that is not working with another computer. If multiple mice do not work, the computer port is bad. If your using PS/2 or USB port on the back of the computer, the motherboard is bad and would need to be replaced. If the mouse does not work with more than one computer, the mouse is bad and should be replaced.	bad mouse .#@#if the above step do not solve the problem , try another mouse .#@#if the another mouse work , try the mouse that be not work with another computer .#@#if multiple mouse do not work , the computer port be bad .#@#if you use PS/2 or usb port on the back of the computer , the motherboard be bad and would need to be replace .#@#if the mouse do not work with more than one computer , the mouse be bad and should be replace . 25	ch000445	0	Basic network troubleshooting	Adapter resources .  Verify that the network adapter is properly installed and detected by the computer with no conflicts. If you're using Microsoft Windows check in Device Manager and verify there are no errors and "Network adapters" is present with each network adapter installed in the computer listed, similar to the example on the right. How do I get into Windows Device Manager? Identifying problems in Windows Device Manager. If conflicts exist or the network adapter is being detected as an Other device. The network card has not been properly installed in the computer. Try letting Windows re-detect and install the Network card by removing the network adapter and any other conflict devices from Device Manager and then rebooting the computer. If Windows re-detects the card but does not find the drivers, download the network adapter drivers from the computer manufacturer or the network card manufacturer. How do I remove a device in Windows Device Manager? Listing of network drivers and network card manufacturers.	adapter resource .#@#verify that the network adapter be properly install and detect by the computer with no conflict .#@#if you be use Microsoft Windows check in Device Manager and verify there be no error and `` Network adapter '' be present with each network adapter install in the computer list , similar to the example on the right .#@#how do I get into Windows Device Manager ?#@#identify problem in Windows Device Manager .#@#if conflict exist or the network adapter be be detect as a other device .#@#the network card have not be properly install in the computer .#@#try let Windows re-detect and install the Network card by remove the network adapter and any other conflict device from Device Manager and then reboot the computer .#@#if Windows re-detect the card but do not find the driver , download the network adapter driver from the computer manufacturer or the network card manufacturer .#@#how do I remove a device in Windows Device Manager ?#@#listing of network driver and network card manufacturer . 25	ch000445	1	Basic network troubleshooting	Verify connections .  Wired Network .  If this is a wired network, verify that the network cable is properly connected and make sure the LEDs next to the network jack are properly illuminated. For example, a network card with a solid green LED or light usually indicates that the card is either connected or receiving a signal. If the green light is flashing, this is an indication of data being sent or received. In the picture to the right, is an example of LAN port with two LED indicators next to the RJ-45 port. With this port, one LED will light up if connected properly and the other will flash when transmitting data. If there are no lights or the lights are orange or red .  the card may be bad, not connected properly, or that the card is not receiving a signal from the network. If you are on a small or local network and have the capability of checking a hub , switch , or router verify that the cables are properly connected and that it has power. If after checking the connections the LED indicators appear bad, the network adapter, port, or cable may be defective. Wireless Network .  If you're using a laptop with a wireless network make sure if the laptop has a Wi-Fi button that it is turned on. Many laptops will have a Wi-Fi button that allows the wireless network to be turned on and off. In the picture to the right, is an example of a Wi-Fi button that is currently enabled. If the Wi-Fi button is turned on, make sure you're connecting to the correct Wi-Fi hotspot by right-clicking on the Network icon in the Windows notification area and clicking "Connect to a network". Usually, the network with the strongest connection (the most bars) will be your wireless router. Finally, when connecting to most wireless networks you will need to enter the proper SSID (password) in order to connect to the network. If the incorrect SSID has been entered you will be denied access to the network.	verify connection .#@#wire Network .#@#if this be a wire network , verify that the network cable be properly connect and make sure the led next to the network jack be properly illuminate .#@#for example , a network card with a solid green led or light usually indicate that the card be either connect or receive a signal .#@#if the green light be flash , this be a indication of datum be send or receive .#@#in the picture to the right , be a example of LAN port with two lead indicator next to the rj-45 port .#@#with this port , one led will light up if connect properly and the other will flash when transmit datum .#@#if there be no light or the light be orange or red .#@#the card may be bad , not connect 25	ch000445	2	Basic network troubleshooting	Adapter functionality .  Verify that the network card is capable of pinging itself by using the ping command . Windows users can ping the computer from a Windows command line . Unix and Linux users can ping from the shell . To ping the card or the localhost, type either .  or .  Doing either of the above commands should get replies from the network card. If you receive an error or if the transmission fails the network card is not physically installed into the computer correctly, has the incorrect drivers, or that the card is bad.	adapter functionality .#@#verify that the network card be capable of ping itself by use the ping command .#@#Windows user can ping the computer from a Windows command line .#@#Unix and Linux user can ping from the shell .#@#to ping the card or the localhost , type either .#@#or .#@#do either of the above command should get reply from the network card .#@#if you receive a error or if the transmission fail the network card be not physically install into the computer correctly , have the incorrect driver , or that the card be bad . 25	ch000445	3	Basic network troubleshooting	Connect to the router .  If all of the above steps have been checked and your network has a router , make sure the computer can connect to the router by performing the below commands. Determine the routers address .  Using the ipconfig command (or ifconfig command for Linux) determine the router's address by looking at the Gateway address. Below are the steps for Microsoft Windows users, Linux users can substitute ipconfig for ifconfig. Open the Windows command line. From the command prompt type ipconfig and press enter. This command should give you an output similar to the below example. Ethernet adapter Local Area Connection: Connection-specific DNS Suffix . : computerhope.com. IP Address. . . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.103 Subnet Mask . . . . . . . . . . . : 255.255.255.0 .  Default Gateway . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.1 .  The Default Gateway is the address of your router. Most home routers will have a gateway address that starts with 192.168 like the address shown above. Assuming your gateway address is 192.168.1.1 attempt to ping the router to see if it can send and receive information by running the below command. If you get replies back from the router, the connection between your router and computer are good, and you can skip to the next step . If you do not receive any replies back from the router either the router is not setup properly or your connection between the router and the computer are not correct. Reset your router to make sure it is not a problem with your router by following the below steps. Turn off the power to the computer and leave it off. Unplug the power to your router and cable modem or DSL modem . Leave the power cables disconnected for 10-15 seconds and then plug in your modem and then your router again. Finally, turn on your computer again and repeat this step to see if you can ping your router. If you're using a wireless network and have followed all the above steps and still are unable to ping the router try turning off the computer again and connect the computer to the router using a cable instead of trying to connect using wireless. If a wire does also not work connect the manufacturer of the router for additional support or replacement.	connect to the router .#@#if all of the above step have be check and you network have a router , make sure the computer can connect to the router by perform the below command .#@#determine the router address .#@#use the ipconfig command -lrb- or ifconfig command for linux -rrb- determine the router 's address by look at the Gateway address .#@#Below be the step for Microsoft Windows user , linux user can substitute ipconfig for ifconfig .#@#open the Windows command line .#@#from the command prompt type ipconfig and press enter .#@#this command should give you a output similar to the below example .#@#Ethernet adapter local area connection : connection-specific dn suffix .#@#: computerhope.com .#@#IP Address ... ... .#@#.#@#: 192.168.1.103 subnet mask ... ... .#@#: 255.255.255.0 .#@#Default Gateway ... ... : 192.168.1.1 .#@#the Default Gateway be the address of you router .#@#most home router will have a gateway address that start with 192.168 like the address show above .#@#assume you gateway address be 192.168.1.1 attempt to ping the router to see if it can send and receive information by run the below command .#@#if you get reply back from the router , the connection between you router and computer be good , and you can skip to the next step .#@#if you do not receive any reply back from the router either the router be not setup properly or you connection between the router and the computer be not correct .#@#reset you router to make sure it be not a support or replacement
25	ch000445	4	Basic network troubleshooting	Firewall .  If your computer network utilizes a firewall , make sure all required ports required are open, especially port 80, which is the HTTP port. If possible, disable the firewall software program or disconnect the computer from the firewall to make sure it is not causing the network problems.	firewall .#@#if you computer network utilize a firewall , make sure all require port require be open , especially port 80 , which be the HTTP port .#@#if possible , disable the firewall software program or disconnect the computer from the firewall to make sure it be not cause the network problem . (ROOT (NP (NN Firewall) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (SINV (S (SBAR (IN If) (S (NP (PRP$ your) (NN computer) (NN network)) (VP (VBZ utilizes) (NP (DT a) (NN firewall)))) (, ,)) (VP (VBP make) (S (ADJP (JJ sure)) (NP (NP (DT all) (VBN required) (NNS ports)) (VP (VBN required)))))) (VP (VBP are) (ADJP (JJ open) (, ,) (RB especially) (JJ port))) (NP (NP (CD 80)) (, ,) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT which)) (S (VP (VBZ is) (NP (DT the) (NNP HTTP) (NN port)))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (PP (IN If) (ADJP (JJ possible))) (, ,) (VP (VP (VB disable) (NP (DT the) (NN firewall) (NN software) (NN program))) (CC or) (VP (VB disconnect) (NP (DT the) (NN computer)) (PP (IN from) (NP (DT the) (NN firewall) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB make) (ADJP (JJ sure) (SBAR (S (NP (PRP it)) (VP (VBZ is) (RB not) (VP (VBG causing) (NP (DT the) (NN network) (NNS problems)))))))))))))) (. .)))	firewall if you computer network utilize a firewall make sure all require port require be open especially port NUM which be the http port if possible disable the firewall software program or disconnect the computer from the firewall to make sure it be not cause the network problem
25	ch000445	5	Basic network troubleshooting	Internet is not working .  If you're able to ping the router, but are still unable to connect to the Internet, either your router is improperly configured or the ISP is having issues. Note: Some ISPs such as Comcast require special software be installed. Make sure any software included with your Modem or other hardware has been installed on at least one computer if you are setting up a new Internet connection. If your Internet has been working but recently stopped working, give it a few minutes to make sure it is not a temporary outage. If after waiting a few minutes, you still have problems and you have not disconnected the power to your router and modem already follow the below steps. Turn off the power to the computer and leave it off. Unplug the power to your router and cable modem or DSL modem . Leave the power cables disconnected for 10-15 seconds and then plug in your modem and then your router again. Finally, turn on your computer again and repeat this step to see if you can ping your router.   If after following the above steps the Internet is still not working, open the Windows command line and run the below command. Running the above command should get a reply from Google. If you get a reply, this is an indication that the Internet is working, but you may be encountering a problem with the Internet browser you are using to browse the Internet. Try an alternative browser such as Firefox or Chrome . If you're getting no reply from Google, your router or modem is not reaching the Internet. If you have a router, make sure your router has DHCP enabled and that the WAN or Gateway address is the proper ISP address. Finally, after verifying all of the above settings if your Internet is still not working we suggest contacting the ISP to make sure it is not a problem on their end and to assist you further with any special configurations that may not be mentioned in this document.	internet be not work .#@#if you be able to ping the router , but be still unable to connect to the internet , either you router be improperly configure or the isp be have issue .#@#note : some isp such as Comcast require special software be install .#@#make sure any software include with you modem or other hardware have be install on at least one computer if you be set up a new internet connection .#@#if you internet have be work but recently stop work , give it a few minute to make sure it be not a temporary outage you computer again and repeat this step to see if you can ping you router .#@#if after follow the above step the internet be still not work , open the Windows command line and run the below command 25	ch000445	6	Basic network troubleshooting	Additional troubleshooting .  Another method of determining network issues is to use the tracert command if you are a Windows user or the traceroute command if you are a Linux or Unix variant user. This command will give you an overview of each of the devices (routers) a packet travels ( hops ) over a network and can give you an idea of where a problem exists in your network or outside of your network. To use this command you must be at the command line and type one of the below commands depending on your operating system. or .  If run successfully you should begin to see each hop between the computer and network devices. When the connection fails, determine what device is causing the issue by reviewing the traceroute listing.	additional troubleshooting .#@#another method of determine network issue be to use the tracert command if you be a Windows user or the traceroute command if you be a linux or Unix variant user .#@#this command will give you a overview of each of the device -lrb- router -rrb- a packet travels -lrb- hop -rrb- over a network and can give you a idea of where a problem exist in you network or outside of you network .#@#to use this command you must be at the command line and type one of the below command depend on you operating system .#@#or .#@#if run successfully you should begin to see each hop between the computer and network device .#@#when the connection fail , determine what device be cause the issue by review the traceroute listing . (ROOT (NP (JJ Additional) (NN troubleshooting) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (NP (NP (DT Another) (NN method)) (PP (IN of) (S (VP (VBG determining) (NP (NN network) (NNS issues)))))) (VP (VBZ is) (S (VP (TO to) packet) (NNS travels)) (PRN (-LRB- -LRB-) (VP (VBZ hops)) (-RRB- -RRB-))) (PP (IN over) (NP (DT a) (NN network))))))) (CC and) (VP (MD can) (VP (VB give) (NP (PRP you)) (NP (NP (DT an) (NN idea)) (PP 26	ch000186	0	How to erase my hard drive and start over	Erasing the hard drive .  Tip: If you have an OEM computer (Acer, ASUS, Dell, Hewlett Packard, etc.) it's likely that you have a hidden System Recovery partition and don't need to use any CD or DVD to restore your computer. How do I install Microsoft Windows XP. How to install Microsoft Windows 2000. The below steps are for users with MS-DOS 5.0+, Windows 3.x, Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows ME, and Windows NT 4.0. Place the bootable diskette or disc inside the computer and reboot to get to the DOS prompt. In some cases you may need to boot the computer with CD-ROM support or press a key to boot from the disk. At the MS-DOS prompt type format c: /s .  The computer will ask you "Are you sure you want to erase everything on drive c:" if you are ok with doing this press "Y" for yes and press enter. After doing this, the computer will begin the formatting process. While the computer is formatting make sure no errors are encountered . Once the format process is completed successfully, at the MS-DOS prompt type fdisk /mbr and press enter. This should return you back to the MS-DOS prompt with no message. This step is not required but recommended. Once back at the MS-DOS prompt, reboot the computer with the boot disk still in the computer. Once back at the MS-DOS prompt, insert either the diskettes for MS-DOS, Windows 3.x, Windows 95, or the CD for Windows 95, Windows 98 or Windows NT and click the appropriate link .  MS-DOS users .  Windows 3.x users .  Windows 95 floppy diskette users .  Windows 95 CD users .  Windows 98 users .  Windows NT 4.0 users	erase the hard drive .#@#tip : if you have a OEM computer -lrb- Acer , ASUS , Dell , Hewlett Packard , etc. -rrb- it be likely that you have a hidden system recovery partition and do not need to use any cd or dvd to restore you computer .#@#how do I install Microsoft Windows xp .#@#how to install Microsoft Windows 2000 .#@#the below step be for user with ms-do 5.0 + , Windows 3 26	ch000186	1	How to erase my hard drive and start over	Windows NT 4.0 users .  Windows NT can be installed several different ways. We recommend that Windows NT be installed using the below steps as we feel that these steps by far are the easiest way to install Windows NT 4.0. First, we recommend that all users wanting to install Windows NT use the /b switch, which allows the users to not need to create the diskettes. We do, however, recommend that the user create the Emergency recover diskettes if they have not already been created after the installation of Windows NT. Finally, before the installation of Windows NT, it is recommended that you run SMARTDRV, which will help the installation of Windows NT run a lot faster. Place the CD into the computer. Type X: (where x is the CD-ROM drive, often this is D:). Once at the appropriate drive, type CD WINNT and press enter to get into the Windows 95 directory. Once at X:\WINNT> Type winnt /b. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation.	Windows NT 4.0 user .#@#Windows NT can be install several different way .#@#we recommend that Windows NT be install use the below step as we feel that these step by far be the easiest way to install Windows NT 4.0 .#@#first , we recommend that all user want to install Windows NT use the / b switch , which allow the user to not need to create the diskette .#@#we do , however , recommend that the user create the emergency recover diskette if they have not already be create after the installation of Windows NT .#@#finally , before the installation of Windows NT , it be recommend that you run smartdrv , which will help the installation of Windows NT run a lot faster .#@#place the CD into the computer .#@#type x : -lrb- where x be the cd-rom drive , often this be d :-rrb-_NN .#@#once at the appropriate drive , type CD WINNT and press enter to get into the Windows 95 directory .#@#once at x : \ winnt > type winnt / b. follow the on-screen instruction to complete the installation . Once at the appropriate drive, type CD WIN95 and press enter to get into the Windows 95 directory. Once at X:\WIN95> Type setup to begin the installation .  Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation. If you are encountering issues during the setup process, you can add additional switches to the setup command line. These switches can be found on our Windows 95 Setup Switches page . 27	ch000700	1	What should I do when a computer freezes?	Is the computer dead locked? See if the computer is able to respond to anything by pressing the Caps Lock key on the keyboard and watching the Caps Lock led (light) to see if it able to turn off and on. If the computer is able to turn on and off Caps Lock, continue to the next step . If nothing happens, the computer is dead locked, and you must reboot the computer .	be the computer dead lock ?#@#see if the computer be able to respond to anything by press the cap lock key on the keyboard and watch the cap lock lead -lrb- light -rrb- to see if it able to turn off and on .#@#if the computer be able to turn on and off cap lock , continue to the next step .#@#if nothing happen , the computer be dead lock , and you must reboot the computer . 27	ch000700	2	What should I do when a computer freezes?	End Task the not responding program .  If the Caps Lock can turn off and on Windows is still working, but another program may not be responding and causing the computer to freeze. Press .  Ctrl .  + Alt .  + Del .  to open the Windows Task Manager. If the Task Manager is able to open highlight the program not responding and choose End Task , which should unfreeze the computer.	end Task the not respond program .#@#if the cap lock can turn off and on Windows be still work , but another program may not be respond and cause the computer to freeze .#@#Press .#@#ctrl .#@#+ Alt .#@#+ Del .#@#to open the Windows Task Manager .#@#if the Task Manager be able to open highlight the program not respond and choose end Task , which should unfreeze the computer . 27	ch000700	3	What should I do when a computer freezes?	Reboot a frozen computer .  If none of the above steps helped, you must reboot the computer. To reboot a frozen computer press and hold down the power button until the computer turns off. Once the computer is off, wait a few seconds and then turn the computer back on and let it start as normal.	reboot a frozen computer .#@#if none of the above step help , you must reboot the computer .#@#to reboot a frozen computer press and hold down the power button until the computer turn off .#@#once the computer be off , wait a few seconds and then turn the computer back on and let it start as normal .
