In most cases a game will start out as version 1.0.	verify no patch or update be available from the developer of the game .#@#see the game developer page for a listing of link to game company page .#@#many time the game developer will list the available driver .#@#if you be not sure who the developer of a game be , use a popular search engine and search for driver for you game .#@#in most case a game will start out as version 1.0 . 34	chope-software-issues.txt	0	Problems connecting to an online game server	Verify no patches or updates are available from the developer of the game. Many times to connect to a game, you must be running the same version as the server. See the game developer page for a listing of links to game company pages. Many times the game developer will list the available drivers. If you are not sure who the developer of a game is, use a popular search engine and search for drivers for your game. In most cases a game will start out as version 1.0.	verify no patch or update be available from the developer of the game .#@#many time to connect to a game , you must be run the same version as the server .#@#see the game developer page for a listing of link to game company page .#@#many time the game developer will list the available driver .#@#if you be not sure who the developer of a game be , use a popular search engine and search for driver for you game .#@#in most case a game will start out as version 1.0 . 35	chope-software-issues.txt	6	Internet explorer troubleshooting	Disable or uninstall all Internet Explorer Add-ons. Or if this is something you wish to delete click the Delete button. Not all programs will have the option to delete, if this add-on is a toolbar, toolbars and many other add-ons are usually deleted through the Add/Remove programs.	disable or uninstall all internet Explorer add-on .#@#to do this click tool , Internet Options , click the Programs tab , and then click the manage add-on button .#@#in the manage add-on window , highlight each of the add-on and then select Disable .#@#or if this be something you wish to delete click the delete button .#@#not all program will have the option to delete , if this add-on be a toolbar , toolbar and many other add-on be usually delete through the Add/Remove program . 39	chope-software-issues.txt	0	Error messages encountered during boot (MS-DOS)	Ensure that your computer BIOS settings are correctly configured to the hardware that is installed in your computer. Improper settings in the BIOS may cause various errors when first booting an IBM compatible computer. These errors often occur as the computer is first booting and may stop the load process of the computer.	ensure that you computer bio setting be correctly configure to the hardware that be install in you computer .#@#improper setting in the bio may cause various error when first boot a IBM compatible computer .#@#these error often occur as the computer be first booting and may stop the load process of the computer . 42	chope-software-issues.txt	0	Error messages while Windows is loading (Windows 3.x)	Exit to a MS-DOS prompt. At the MS-DOS prompt, type: cd\windows and press enter. from the C:\Windows> prompt, type dir system.* and dir win.* this will enable to you see if any backups of the system.ini or win.ini are available, and if so, what they are named. You should be looking for a system and win file that end with either ---, bac, or bak. If this file is present then continue with the remainder of the steps. Unfortunately, if this file is not found, you will be unable to proceed with this recommendation. If you were able to locate a backup file, type ren system.ini system.ch and ren win.ini win.ch to rename the current system.ini and win.ini files. Finally, type copy system.??? system.ini and copy win.??? win.ini where ??? is the name of the backup extension you were able to locate.	exit to a ms-do prompt .#@#at the ms-do prompt , type : cd \ window and press enter .#@#from the c : \ Windows > prompt , type dir system .#@#* and dir win .#@#* this will enable to you see if any backup of the system.ini or win.ini be available , and if so , what they be name .#@#you should be look for a system and win file that end with either -- , bac , or bak .#@#if this file be present then continue with the remainder of the step .#@#unfortunately , if this file be not find , you will be unable to proceed with this recommendation .#@#if you be able to locate a backup file , type ren system.ini system.ch and ren win.ini win.ch to rename the current system.ini and win.ini file .#@#finally , type copy system .#@#???#@#system.ini and copy win .#@#???#@#win.ini where ???#@#be the name of the backup extension you be able to locate . 42	chope-software-issues.txt	1	Error messages while Windows is loading (Windows 3.x)	If your computer has a virus protection program installed, make sure it is up to date and that no viruses are being detected. If your computer does not have a virus protection program, you may wish to consider installing a program to make sure no viruses are causing your problems. Information about updating your antivirus program can be found on document CH000533 and information about what antivirus programs are available can be found on document CH000514.	if you computer have a virus protection program install , make sure it be up to date and that no virus be be detect .#@#if you computer do not have a virus protection program , you may wish to consider install a program to make sure no virus be cause you problem .#@#information about update you antivirus program can be find on document ch000533 and information about what antivirus program be available can be find on document ch000514 . 43	chope-software-issues.txt	4	Computer running slowly (Windows 3.x)	Delete all the temporary files and any scandisk error files. From the MS- DOS prompt C:\> Type del *.tmp to delete all temporary files, also type del *.chk. Once the files have been deleted, type cd\dos to get into the DOS directory and delete the *.tmp and *.chk files like was done earlier. Finally, type cd\windows to get into the Windows directory and delete the *.tmp and *.chk files like was done earlier.	delete all the temporary file and any scandisk error file .#@#from the m - do prompt c :\ > type del * .#@#tmp to delete all temporary file , also type del * .#@#chk .#@#once the file have be delete , type cd \ do to get into the DOS directory and delete the * .#@#tmp and * .#@#chk file like be do earlier .#@#finally , type cd \ window to get into the Windows directory and delete the * .#@#tmp and * .#@#chk file like be do earlier . 46	chope-software-issues.txt	4	Computer running slowly (Windows 95)	Windows 95 still utilizes the autoexec.bat and config.sys. Therefore, make sure your autoexec.bat and config.sys are optimized. Changing the way programs load into memory, removing lines that are not necessary, and changing the order of lines in your config.sys can all help with improving the speed of your computer. See the autoexec.bat and config.sys page for additional information. 49	chope-software-issues.txt	0	Computer running slowly (Windows 98)	Make sure your computer has at least 100MB free of hard drive space. 56	chope-software-issues.txt	1	Other error messages that occur while Windows is loading or after Windows is loaded (Windows 2000)	Ensure that if programs are loading automatically that these errors are not associated with these programs. Many times utilities, such as virus programs, may load when Windows first starts and cause errors to occur. If you believe that your startup errors are associated with another program, refer to our basic software troubleshooting.	ensure that if program be load automatically that these error be not associate with these program .#@#many time utility , such as virus program , may load when Windows first start and cause error to occur .#@#if you believe that you startup error be associate with another program , refer to we basic software troubleshooting . 61	ccri.txt	3	The monitor screen is black	Check to see if the monitor getting a signal from the computer. There is a light on the monitor. If the monitor is on, it will be lit. If it is turned on, check the contrast and brightness buttons to see if they have been tampered with. A green light on the front of the monitor would indicate that it is getting a signal from the computer. An orange light would indicate there is not signal from the computer. Make sure the computer is on and you see lights on the front of it. Check the cable that runs from the monitor to the computer to see if it has worked loose.	check to see if the monitor get a signal from the computer .#@#there be a light on the monitor .#@#if the monitor be on , it will be light .#@#if it be turn on , check the contrast and brightness button to see if they have be tamper with .#@#a green light on the front of the monitor would indicate that it be get a signal from the computer .#@#a orange light would indicate there be not signal from the computer .#@#make sure the computer be on and you see light on the front of it .#@#check the cable that run from the monitor to the computer to see if it have work loose . 65	ccri.txt	0	The Printer is not printing	Check to see if the printer getting power If there are no lights or no display on the front of the printer, the printer is not getting electricity or power. Check to make sure the power cord is plugged in both to the wall or power strip and to the back of the printer. Wiggle the power cord where it plugs into the back of the printer to make sure it is not loose. Some models of desk jets have a two part power cord. In this case, check along the length of the power cord to make sure both parts are plugged in together. If the printer is still not getting power, plug the power cord into a different outlet on the power strip. If this does not work, try plugging the printer into a different wall outlet.	check to see if the printer get power if there be no light or no display on the front of the printer , the printer be not get electricity or power .#@#check to make sure the power cord be plug in both to the wall or power strip and to the back of the printer .#@#wiggle the power cord where it plug into the back of the printer to make sure it be not loose .#@#some model of desk jet have a two part power cord .#@#in this case , check along the length of the power cord to make sure both part be plug in together .#@#if the printer be still not get power , plug the power cord into a different outlet on the power strip .#@#if this do not work , try plug the printer into a different wall outlet . 65	ccri.txt	1	The Printer is not printing	Check to see if you can print a Windows test page The windows test page is a basic communication test between your computer and the printer. To print a Windows test page: Left mouse-click on the Start button. Go to Settings and then select Printers. Inside the printer window, you should see a small printer icon with the name of printer you are trying to print to. Place your mouse arrow on the small printer icon and right mouse-click. A small gray window should appear and the last choice in the box is Properties. Left mouse-click on Properties. A printer window with several tabs should appear. On the General tab, there is a Print Test Page button in the lower right corner. Left mouse-click on the button. You may click on the "Yes" button on your screen, but the real question is: Did anything print from the printer? If the answer is no, please call or e-mail the Service Desk at x1112. If you can print a Windows test page, try to print from a different program. If the document does not print from that program, the printing problem has to do with that program.	check to see if you can print a Windows test page the window test page be a basic communication test between you computer and the printer .#@#to print a Windows test page : leave mouse-click on the Start button .#@#go to setting and then select printer .#@#inside the printer window , you should see a small printer icon with the name of printer you be try to print to .#@#place you mouse arrow on the small printer icon and right mouse-click .#@#a small gray window should appear and the last choice in the box be Properties .#@#leave mouse-click on Properties .#@#a printer window with several tab should appear .#@#on the General tab , there be a print test Page button in the lower right corner .#@#leave mouse-click on the button .#@#you may click on the `` yes '' button on you screen , but the real question be : do anything print from the printer ?#@#if the answer be no , please call or e-mail the Service desk at x1112 .#@#if you can print a Windows test page , try to print from a different program .#@#if the document do not print from that program , the printing problem have to do with that program . do not print from that program the printing problem have to do with that program
65	ccri.txt	2	The Printer is not printing	Check to see if there is paper in printer. Is their a paper jam? If the printer has paper in the paper tray, the paper may be jammed or not feeding properly. Take the paper out of the paper tray and check to see that the top piece of paper is not crinkled or bent. If the printer is a DeskJet, lift open the front cover and look to see if a piece of paper is halfway fed through. If it is, remove paper gently from the top and close. If the printer is a LaserJet, open the top of the printer and check for paper underneath the toner cartridge. If there is paper there, gently remove it, and replace the toner cartridge.	check to see if there be paper in printer .#@#be they a paper jam ?#@#if the printer have paper in the paper tray , the paper may be jam or not feed properly .#@#take the paper out of the paper tray and check to see that the top piece of paper be not crinkled or bent .#@#if the printer be a DeskJet , lift open the front cover and look to see if a piece of paper be halfway feed through .#@#if it be , remove paper gently from the top and close .#@#if the printer be a LaserJet , open the top of the printer and check for paper underneath the toner cartridge .#@#if there be paper there , gently remove it , and replace the toner cartridge . 65	ccri.txt	3	The Printer is not printing	Check to see if the computer getting a signal from the printer. The computer and the printer must be communicating before the printer will print. When you send a document to print, does a small printer appear on the Windows taskbar (down by the time)? If this printer appears on the taskbar, the computer thinks the printer is receiving communication. At this point, the printer should blink lights (if a DeskJet) or says "printing" or "receiving" on the display (if a laser printer). If the printer is not receiving the communication from the computer, try restarting the computer. After you have logged in, see if you can print now.	check to see if the computer get a signal from the printer .#@#the computer and the printer must be communicate before the printer will print .#@#when you send a document to print , do a small printer appear on the Windows taskbar -lrb- down by the time -rrb- ?#@#if this printer appear on the taskbar , the computer think the printer be receive communication .#@#at this point , the printer should blink light -lrb- if a DeskJet -rrb- or say `` printing '' or `` receive '' on the display -lrb- if a laser printer -rrb- .#@#if the printer be not receive the communication from the computer , try restart the computer .#@#after you have log in , see if you can print now . 65	ccri.txt	4	The Printer is not printing	Check to see if Printer offline or Paused. If the printer is off-line or paused, the print jobs will just stack up in the print queue but nothing prints. Left mouse-click on the Start button Go to Settings Then choose Printers The Printer folder should open and display the printers installed on this PC. Place your mouse arrow on the printer you are checking and right mouse click. A dialog box should open. If the printer is paused or offline you will see a black check mark next to the words "Pause Printing" or "Printer Offline." Left mouse-click on the black check mark and see if you can "uncheck" it. If the check mark will not go away, try restarting the PC (Start  Shutdown  Restart). Then repeat steps 1 through 7 again. If the printer is still not printing, please contact the Service Desk at x1112	check to see if printer offline or pause .#@#if the printer be off-line or pause , the print job will just stack up in the print queue but nothing print .#@#leave mouse-click on the Start button go to setting then choose printer the printer folder should open and display the printer install on this pc .#@#place you mouse arrow on the printer you be check and right mouse click .#@#a dialog box should open .#@#if the printer be pause or offline you will see a black check mark next to the word `` Pause Printing '' or `` Printer Offline . 65	ccri.txt	5	The Printer is not printing	Check to see if there multiple jobs in the Print queue. If the printer is a local printer (i.e., there is a cable running directly from the printer to the computer you are printing from), power off the PC, power off the printer, count to 10, and then turn both the printer and the computer back on again. Sometimes this will allow the printer to start printing again.	check to see if there multiple job in the print queue .#@#if the printer be a local printer -lrb- i.e. , there be a cable run directly from the printer to the computer you be print from -rrb- , power off the pc , power off the printer , count to 10 , and then turn both the printer and the computer back on again .#@#sometimes this will allow the printer to start print again . 66	ccri.txt	0	The printer is printing streaks on the page	If the printer is a DeskJet, go to the HP DeskJet Utilities menu in the Program menu. Choose the "Clean the Print Cartridges" option. If this does not work, try replacing the ink cartridge. If the new cartridge does not help the streaking, place the cartridge back inside the original packaging and save it until the other cartridge has been used up. This just tests to see if the ink cartridge is defective.	if the printer be a DeskJet , go to the HP DeskJet Utilities menu in the program menu .#@#choose the `` clean the print cartridge '' option .#@#if this do not work , try replace the ink cartridge .#@#if the new cartridge do not help the streak , place the cartridge back inside the original packaging and save it until the other cartridge have be use up .#@#this just test to see if the ink cartridge be defective . 66	ccri.txt	3	The printer is printing streaks on the page	Turn the PC off. If the printer is a local printer, i.e., has a direct cable hookup to the PC, turn the printer off also so both the PC and printer are turned off at the same time. After 30 seconds, turn the PC and the printer back on again. Try to print a Windows test page. If the printer still does not print, please contact the Service Desk x1112.	turn the pc off .#@#if the printer be a local printer , i.e. , have a direct cable hookup to the pc , turn the printer off also so both the pc and printer be turn off at the same time .#@#after 30 seconds , turn the pc and the printer back on again .#@#try to print a Windows test page .#@#if the printer still do not print , please contact the Service desk x1112 . 67	ccri.txt	1	The computer won't read the CD	Check to see if the CD be read from the CD Rom drive of another computer If the CD can be read from another computer's CD ROM drive, the CD ROM drive may be bad and need to be replaced. The CD ROM drive may also have dirt or debris inside. Try cleaning the drive with a standard audio CD player cleaning kit. After cleaning the drive, try to read the CD again.	check to see if the CD be read from the CD Rom drive of another computer if the CD can be read from another computer 's CD ROM drive , the CD ROM drive may be bad and need to be replace .#@#the CD ROM drive may also have dirt or debris inside .#@#try clean the drive with a standard audio CD player cleaning kit .#@#after clean the drive , try to read the CD again . 67	ccri.txt	2	The computer won't read the CD	Check to see if the CD scratched or dirty CD, CDR, or CDRW drives read discs by shining a laser onto the CD and then measuring the amount of light that gets reflected back. Most of the time a small scratch won't matter. If the CD is dirty, you can clean the CD using a CD Cleaning kit or you can also use a mild detergent, like dish soap, and warm water, wash the CD and dry with a soft cloth. Once the CD is fully dry, insert the CD into the CD ROM drive and try to read it. If the CD is not dirty, you can try to clean the CD Rom drive using a professional CD cleaner kit	check to see if the CD scratch or dirty cd , CDR , or cdrw drive read disc by shine a laser onto the 67	ccri.txt	3	The computer won't read the CD	Check to see if the CD is a CD-R or CD-RW that was burned A number of older CD drives cannot read some types of CD-R CDs. Try using a different CD-R disk with a different dye under the reflective layer. You will have noticed that some CD-R disks are blue, gold, green, or even silver colored. Some of the colors have a lower light reflectivity value and an older CD Rom drive may have difficulty reading that brand of CD-R media.	check to see if the CD be a cd-r or cd-rw that be burn a number of older cd drive can not read some type of cd-r cd .#@#try use a different cd-r disk with a different dye under the reflective layer .#@#you will have notice that some cd-r disk be blue , gold , green , or even silver color .#@#some of the color have a lower light reflectivity value and a older cd rom drive may have difficulty read that brand of cd-r media . 69	ccri.txt	1	The mouse will only move one way, either vertically or horizontally	Shut down your machine and unplug your mouse from the computer. Open the underside of the mouse and remove the ball. If the ball is a rubber ball, do not clean it with alcohol. Clean it with a soft cloth. There should be no lubricant placed on a mouse ball. Clean the roller in the body of the mouse with a cotton swab that is slightly damp with alcohol. Replace the ball when the rollers are dry and replace the bottom portion.	shut down you machine and unplug you mouse from the computer .#@#open the underside of the mouse and remove the ball .#@#if the ball be a rubber ball , do not clean it with alcohol .#@#clean it with a soft cloth .#@#there should be no lubricant place on a mouse ball .#@#clean the roller in the body of the mouse with a cotton swab that be slightly damp with alcohol .#@#replace the ball when the roller be dry and replace the bottom portion . 70	ccri.txt	0	The cursor is stuck on the hourglass	Open Task Manager Simultaneously press [Ctrl] [Alt] [Delete]. You will see a list of all tasks (programs) currently running. Another dialog box will open stating that the program is not responding. 81	hp.txt	1	I cannot connect to the Internet.	Verify that you are using the proper cables for your Internet connection type. Your computer may have a modem and an Ethernet network adapter (also called a network interface card, or NIC). A modem uses a standard telephone cable to make a dial-up connection. A NIC uses a network cable to connect to a local area network (LAN). Do not connect a telephone cable to the NIC. Do not plug a network cable into a telephone service line; doing so may damage the NIC.	verify that you be use the proper cable for you internet connection type .#@#you computer may have a modem and a Ethernet network adapter -lrb- also call a network interface card , or nic -rrb- .#@#a modem use a standard telephone cable to make a dial-up connection .#@#a nic use a network cable to connect to a local area network -lrb- lan -rrb- .#@#do not connect a telephone cable to the nic .#@#do not plug a network cable into a telephone service line ; do so may damage the nic . 90	hp.txt	2	Applications and files take longer to open or respond.	Run the Disk Defragmenter program to group fragmented files together on your hard disk drive and improve performance. This does not affect the location of files and folders on your computer. NOTE: The Disk Defragmenter program may take a long time to complete. It is a good idea to run it overnight. To run the Disk Defragmenter program: 1 Save your work and close all other programs. 2 Press the Ctrl key, the Alt key, and the Delete key at the same time. 3 Click Start Task Manager. 4 On the Applications tab, select all the programs that are listed, and then click End Task. 5 Click the Windows Start Button, choose All Programs, Accessories, System Tools, and then click Disk Defragmenter. 6 Click Defragment now. 90	hp.txt	3	Applications and files take longer to open or respond.	Remove unused programs:1 Click the Windows Start Button, and then click Control Panel. 2 Click Uninstall a program. The Programs and Features window opens. 3 Select the program you wish to remove and click Uninstall. Follow the onscreen instructions. Check for hard disk drive errors: 1 Close all open programs and windows. 2 Click the Windows Start Button, and then click Computer. 3 Right-click the hard disk drive that you want to check, and then click Properties. 4 In the System Properties window, click the Tools tab. 5 Under Error-checking, click Check Now. 6 If desired, select the buttons next to Automatically fix file system errors and Scan for and attempt recovery of bad sectors. 7 Click Start. If prompted to restart, click Yes and allow the computer to restart.	remove unused program :1 click the Windows Start Button , and then click control panel .#@#2 click Uninstall a program .#@#the Programs and Features window open .#@#3 Select the program you wish to remove and click Uninstall .#@#follow the onscreen instruction .#@#check for hard disk drive error : 1 Close all open program and window .#@#2 click the Windows Start Button , and then click computer .#@#3 right-click the hard disk drive that you want to check , and then click Properties .#@#4 in the System Properties window , click the Tools tab .#@#5 under error-checking , click check now .#@#6 if desire , select the button next to automatically fix file system error and scan for and attempt recovery of bad sector .#@#7 click Start .#@#if prompt to restart , click Yes and allow the computer to restart . 93	hp.txt	1	Computer will not respond to USB keyboard or mouse.	Restart computer.	restart computer .	VB NN .	(ROOT (S (VP (VB Restart) (NP (NN computer))) (. .)))	restart computer
94	hp.txt	0	There is no sound or sound volume is too low.	System volume may be set low or muted. Check the F10 BIOS settings to make sure the internal system speaker is not muted (this setting does not affect the external speakers). Make sure the external speakers are properly connected and powered on and that the speakers' volume control is set correctly. Use the system volume control available in the operating system to make sure the speakers are not muted or to increase the volume. 95	hp.txt	8	Poor performance is experienced.	Too many applications running. Close unnecessary applications to free up memory. Add more memory. Some applications run in the background and can be closed by right-clicking on their corresponding icons in the task tray. To prevent these applications from launching at startup, go to Start .  > Run (Windows XP) or Start > Accessories > Run (Windows Vista) and type msconfig . 103	hp.txt	1	Can not write to the media card.	Media card is locked. Locking the media card is a safety feature that prevents writing to and deleting from an SD/Memory Stick/PRO card. If using an SD card, make sure that the lock tab located on the right of the SD card is not in the locked position. If using a Memory Stick/PRO card, make sure that the lock tab located on the bottom of the Memory Stick/PRO card is not in the locked position. 110	hp.txt	0	The picture is broken up, rolls, jitters, or flashes.	The monitor connections may be incomplete or the monitor may be incorrectly adjusted. Be sure the monitor cable is securely connected to the computer. In a two-monitor system or if another monitor is in close proximity, be sure the monitors are not interfering with each others electromagnetic field by moving them apart. Fluorescent lights or fans may be too close to the monitor.	the monitor connection may be incomplete or the monitor may be incorrectly adjust .#@#be sure the monitor cable be securely connect to the computer .#@#in a two-monitor system or if another monitor be in close proximity , be sure the monitor be not interfere with each other 's electromagnetic field by move they apart .#@#fluorescent light or fan may be too close to the monitor . To download a SoftPaq that will assist you with the synchronization, go to the following Web site, select the appropriate monitor, and download either SP32347 or SP32202: 112	hp.txt	1	Sound cuts in and out.	Direct sound latency, common in many media player applications. In Windows XP only: From the Control Panel , select Sounds and Audio Devices . On the Audio tab, select a device from the Sound Playback list. Click the Advanced button and select the Performance tab. Set the Hardware acceleration slider to None and the Sample rate conversion quality slider to Good and retest the audio. Set the Hardware acceleration slider to Full and the Sample rate conversion quality slider to Best and retest the audio.	direct sound latency , common in many media player application .#@#in Windows xp only : from the control panel , select sound and Audio Devices .#@#on the Audio tab , select a device from the sound Playback list .#@#click the Advanced button and select the Performance tab .#@#set the hardware acceleration slider to none and the Sample rate conversion quality slider to good and retest the audio .#@#set the hardware acceleration slider to full and the Sample rate conversion quality slider to best and retest the audio . 118	hp.txt	4	A new device is not recognized as part of the system.	A plug and play board may not automatically configure when added if the default configuration conflicts with other devices. Use Windows Device Manager to deselect the automatic settings for the board and choose a .  basic configuration that does not cause a resource conflict. You can also use Computer Setup to reconfigure or disable devices to resolve the resource conflict.	a plug and play board may not automatically configure when add if the default configuration conflict with other device .#@#Use Windows Device Manager to deselect the automatic setting for the board and choose a .#@#basic configuration that do not cause a resource conflict .#@#you can also use computer setup to reconfigure or disable device to resolve the resource conflict . 137	hp.txt	1	Drive not found (identified).	The system may not have automatically recognized a newly installed device. See reconfiguration directions in the Solving Hardware Installation Problems . If the system still does not recognize the new device, check to see if the device is listed within Computer Setup. If it is listed, the probable cause is a driver problem. If it is not listed, the probable cause is a hardware problem. If this is a newly installed drive, run the Computer Setup utility and try adding a POST delay under Advanced .  > Power-On Options .	the system may not have automatically recognize a newly install device .#@#see reconfiguration direction in the solve hardware installation problem .#@#if the system still do not recognize the new device , check to see if the device be list within computer setup .#@#if it be list , the probable cause be a driver problem .#@#if it be not list , the probable cause be a hardware problem .#@#if this be a newly install drive , run the computer setup utility and try add a post delay under Advanced .#@#> Power-On Options . 147	imperial-college.txt	1	My computer freezes or is behaving strangely	Press the Ctrl & Alt & Del keys on your keyboard together at the same time. This should bring up a menu that will allow you to run Task Manager. In Task Manager, switch to the Applications tab. Highlight any programs with the status 'Not Responding' and choose End Task. 148	imperial-college.txt	4	My computer doesn't power up	Check if there are any lights on at the front of the machine: If there are lights on the machine but not the monitor, then it's probably a monitor issue. If there are lights on the monitor but not the machine, then it's probably a machine issue. If there are no lights on anything, then it may be possible there is a local power cut.	check if there be any light on at the front of the machine : if there be light on the machine but not the monitor , then it be probably a monitor issue .#@#if there be light on the monitor but not the machine , then it be probably a machine issue .#@#if there be no light on anything , then it may be possible there be a local power cut . 154	imperial-college.txt	1	Running a System Restore System	If you cannot boot into Windows, then do the following: Windows Vista/7: Press F8 repeatedly at boot until you get the Windows startup menu. One of the entries in the menu is 'Repair your computer'. This may also be shown automatically as an option if Windows failed to start correctly last time around: First, try running a 'Startup Repair' to fix any problems preventing Windows from starting up correctly (see image below). Failing that, try running 'System Restore' to restore Windows to an earlier point in time (see image below). Windows XP: Press F8 repeatedly at boot until you get the Windows startup menu. Choose 'Safe Mode with Command Prompt. You will need to type in a local administrator username and password. Then type in: %systemroot%\system32\restore\rstrui.exe and press return.	if you can not boot into Windows , then do the following : Windows Vista/7 : Press f8 repeatedly at boot until you get the Windows startup menu .#@#one of the entry in the menu be ` repair you computer ' .#@#this may also be show automatically as a option if Windows fail to start correctly last time around : first , try run a ` Startup Repair ' to fix any problem prevent Windows from start up correctly -lrb- see image below -rrb- .#@#fail that , try run ` System Restore ' to restore Windows to a earlier point in time -lrb- see image below -rrb- .#@#Windows xp : Press f8 repeatedly at boot until you get the Windows startup menu .#@#choose ` Safe Mode with command prompt .#@#you will need to type in a local administrator username and password .#@#then type in : % systemroot % \ system32 \ restore \ rstrui.exe and press return . 159	imperial-college.txt	0	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Run Fewer Programs at the Same Time Don't have too many programs running at the same time. Each running program consumes a bit of the system's resources. Have multiple open windows for the same program (e.g. having three Word documents open) also lowers resources as each window takes up a bit of memory and processing power. If you are not using an open file or program, close it so that the files/programs you are working in can speed up a little.	Run fewer program at the same Time do not have too many program run at the same time .#@#each run program consume a bit of the system 's resource .#@#have multiple open window for the same program -lrb- e.g. have three word document open -rrb- also lower resource as each window take up a bit of memory and processing power .#@#if you be not use a open file or program , close it so that the files/programs you be work in can speed up a little . 159	imperial-college.txt	1	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Restart Your Computer If you haven't restarted your computer for a while, or your normally put it into Sleep or Hibernation modes, allow it to restart. This clears the memory and allows your system to 'clean boot', freeing up resources in the process.	restart you computer if you have not restart you computer for a while , or you normally put it into Sleep or Hibernation mode , allow it to restart .#@#this clear the memory and allow you system to ` clean boot ' , free up resource in the process . 159	imperial-college.txt	2	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Remove Viruses and Malware Viruses and malware can slow down your computer, as well as causing other problems like not allowing you to access the internet or programs installed on your computer. Make sure you have antivirus software installed on your computer, and that it is enabled and up to date. Then run a full system scan to remove anything suspicious from your computer. The College uses Symantec Endpoint Protection to scan for and remove viruses and malware. To check it and run a scan, do the following: Click on Start -> All Programs -> Symantec Endpoint Protection -> Symantec Endpoint Protection. Windows Vista/7 users may get a prompt asking them if they want to allow the program to make changes to their system, so choose Yes: If it is up to date and running, you will see a big .  green tick with the words "Your computer is protected. No problems detected": Click on 'Scan for threats' in the left hand column and then .  click on Full Scan. This may take a while to complete: You can also use a free dedicated malware scanner such as Malwarebyte Anti-Malware to scan your computer. Download, install and run it. Allow it to update itself, and then choose 'Perform full scan': At the end of the scan click on the 'Remove selected' button to remove the malware. You may need to restart your computer:	remove virus and Malware virus and malware can slow down you computer , as well as cause other problem like not allow you to access the internet or program 159	imperial-college.txt	3	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Free up Hard Disk Space Use the Disk Cleanup tool to free up space on your .  hard disk. The tool will scan for files that can be safely deleted. In My Computer, right click on the C: drive icon and choose Properties. Click on the Disk Cleanup button: Disk Properties Disk Cleanup will take a short while to scan the hard drive: Start Disk Cleanup .  Once done, tick the boxes next to the items you would like deleted and then click on Ok to delete. It should be safe to tick all the boxes if you wish: Disk Cleanup List .  Windows 7 users have an additional button labeled 'Clean up system files'. Clicking on this button will add a tab labeled 'More Options'. This will allow you to remove old System Restore points and Shadow Copies (backups) of files, which will free up a lot of space: Advanced Disk Cleanup Options You'll be prompted to confirm that you want to cleanup old restore points:	free up hard disk space use the disk cleanup tool to free up space on you .#@#hard disk .#@#the tool will scan for file that can be safely delete .#@#in my computer In Windows Vista/7: Click on Start and then type into the box cmd.exe (see image below). In the list of programs that appears, right click on cmd.exe and choose 'Run as administrator'. Say Yes to the confirmation prompt: Type in sfc /scannow and press return. This will take a few minutes to scan and fix any problems: In Windows XP: Click on Start and then Run. Type in cmd.exe and click on Ok: Type in sfc /scannow and press return. 159	imperial-college.txt	5	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Uninstall Unnecessary Programs You may have many programs install on your computer that you never use or don't need. Uninstalling these programs can free up hard disk space and speed up your computer. Click on Start and then Control Panel. In Windows XP click on 'Add/Remove Programs'. In Windows Vista/7 click on 'Programs and features'. Select the program you no longer need and click on Remove/Uninstall: Important Note: Be careful what you uninstall, as it may be an important program or system utility. If you are unsure about what is safe to remove or not, please ask a member of DIDE IT. 159	imperial-college.txt	6	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Adjust Windows Visual Effects Windows has a number of stylish visual effects turned on by default. Although these may be pleasing to the eye, they can take up some of your computer's resources and slow it down a little. By turning them off, you free up the resources for your programs to use. In Windows XP: Right click on the My Computer icon and choose Properties. Click on the Advanced tab (see image below). Click on the Settings button under 'Performance': Select 'Adjust for best performance' and click on Ok. This may take a minute to apply the changes and your screen may flicker briefly: Click on Ok to exit System Properties.In Windows Vista/7: Click on Start and then Control Panel. Click on Performance Information and Tools (see image below). Click on Adjust visual effects: Select 'Adjust for best performance' and click on Ok. This may take a minute to apply the changes and your screen may flicker briefly:	adjust Windows Visual Effects Windows have a number of stylish visual effect turn on by default .#@#although these may 159	imperial-college.txt	7	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Run a Disk Scan You may have errors or bad sectors on your hard disk, which can slow down the performance of your computer. Running a disk scan can fix these errors and move data off bad sectors to speed up the reading of data from your hard disk. In My Computer, right click on the C: drive icon and choose Properties. Click on the Tools tab and then click on the Check Now button: Tick the box next to 'Automatically fix file system errors' and 'Scan for and attempt recovery of bad sectors'. Then click on Start: You may get a warning that Windows can't check the disk while it's in use. It will ask you if you want to schedule a check the next time your restart your computer. Click on 'Schedule disk check' and restart your computer. This scan may take a while to complete:	Run a disk scan you may have error or bad sector on you hard disk , which can slow down the performance of you computer .#@#run a disk scan can fix these error can not check the disk while it be in use .#@#it will ask you if you want to schedule a check the next time you restart you computer .#@#click on ` schedule disk check ' and restart you computer 159	imperial-college.txt	8	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Defragment Your Hard Disk Over time, data becomes scattered across your hard disk as it is written, read, and deleted. This can slow down your computer as it takes additional time to find and read the necessary data. By running the disk defragmenter, the data is consolidated in one location and related data is placed near to each other. Click on Start -> All Programs -> Accessories -> System Tools -> Disk Defragmenter. Click on the Analyze button to allow Windows to check if the disk needs to be defragmented (see image below). If Windows reports that the disk needs to be defragmented, click on the Defragment button. This may take some time to complete. Try not to use your computer whilst it is defragmenting:	Defragment you hard disk over time , datum become scattered across you hard disk as it be write , read , and delete .#@#this can slow down you 159	imperial-college.txt	9	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Upgrade your Hardware You may want to consider investing in upgrades for your computer to speed it up. The most common hardware upgrade is memory (RAM). Adding more memory can speed up your computer quite a bit, and it's relatively cheap. It may also be necessary to replace your computer with a new one, as it becomes unfeasible to upgrade very old machines continuously or after several years. If you are considering a hardware upgrade or new computer, please speak to a member of DIDE IT for your available options.	upgrade you Hardware you may want to consider invest in upgrade for you computer to speed it up .#@#the most common hardware upgrade be memory -lrb- RAM -rrb- .#@#add more memory can speed up you computer quite a bit , and it be relatively cheap .#@#it may also be necessary to replace you computer with a new one , as it become unfeasible to upgrade very old machine continuously or after several year .#@#if you be consider a hardware upgrade or new computer , please speak to a member of DIDE IT for you available option . 159	imperial-college.txt	10	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Reinstall Windows Windows can become slow and develop problems after years of use on the same machine. Security updates and patches are applied, programs are installed and uninstalled, and settings are modified regularly. It is therefore a good idea to wipe the hard drive and reinstall Windows from scratch, back to its optimum configuration and performance. Doing this after around three to four years of use may give a noticeable speed improvement. When reinstalling Windows from scratch, it is important to backup any data you have stored on the hard drive, as well as making a note of the programs you would like reinstalled. Please speak to a member of DIDE IT if you think the time has come for your machine to be wiped and setup with a fresh installation of Windows (which will normally be the latest version of Windows). 159	imperial-college.txt	11	Speeding up a Slow Computer	Important note: These steps are for advanced users only. Failure to backup your system and proceed with caution could result in Windows not booting up at all, requiring a reinstall. Please ask a member of DIDE IT if you need assistance with these steps. Use a registry cleaner to delete redundant and incorrect entries in the registry. One example of a good free registry cleaner is CCleaner. Warning: Make sure you create a full backup of your registry first in case you need to revert a change made by a registry cleaner: Manually disable programs from starting up when Windows starts up using the msconfig utility. Click on Start -> Run (or just Start in Vista/7), type in msconfig and press return. Click on the Startup tab to view a list or programs that starts up when Windows does. Uncheck the box next to all the programs you don't want to startup automatically:	important note : these step be for advanced user only .#@#failure to backup you system and proceed with caution could 164	iphone.txt	3	Will not turn on, will not turn on unless connected to power, or unexpected power off	After at least 30 minutes, if: The home screen appears: The iPhone should be working. Update to the latest version of iOS if necessary. Continue charging it until it is completely charged and you see this battery icon in the upper-right corner of the screen . Then unplug the phone from power. If it immediately turns off, seek service. The low-battery image appears, even after the phone has charged for at least 20 minutes: See "iPhone displays the low-battery image and is unresponsive" symptom in this article. Something other than the Home screen or Low Battery image appears, continue with this article for further troubleshooting steps.	after at least 30 minute , if : the home screen appear : the iPhone should be work .#@#Update to the latest version of iOS if necessary .#@#continue charge it until it be completely charge and you see this battery icon in the upper-right corner of the screen .#@#then unplug the phone from power .#@#if it immediately turn off , seek service .#@#the low-battery image appear , even after the phone have charge for at least 20 minute : see `` iPhone display the low-battery image and be unresponsive '' symptom in this article .#@#something other than the Home screen or low battery image appear , continue with this article for further troubleshooting step . 185	iphone.txt	6	Camera isn't functioning	Try to remain steady while focusing: Still images: Remain steady while taking the picture. If you move too far in any direction, the camera automatically refocuses to the center. Note: If you take a picture with iPhone turned sideways, it is automatically saved in landscape orientation. Video: Adjust focus before you begin recording. After recording begins, you cannot readjust focus until you stop recording. Exiting the Camera application while recording will stop recording and will save the video to the Camera Roll. Note: Video-recording features are not available on original iPhone or iPhone 3G.	try to remain steady while focus : still image : remain steady while take the picture .#@#if you move too far in any direction , the camera automatically refocus to the center .#@#note : if you take a picture with iPhone turn sideways , it be automatically save in landscape orientation .#@#Video : adjust focus before you begin record .#@#after record begin , you can not readjust focus until you stop record .#@#exit the Camera application while record will stop record and will save the video to the Camera Roll .#@#note : video-recording feature be not available on original iPhone or iPhone 3G . 186	iphone.txt	0	Accessory not working	Compatibility The first step in troubleshooting any accessory is to determine whether the accessory is compatible with the device. If the accessory is available on the Apple Online Store, see if your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch model is listed. If your accessory uses the 30-pin connector, you may be able to connect it to your device using the Lightning to 30-pin Adapter or Lightning to 30-pin Adapter (0.2 m).	compatibility the first step in troubleshoot any accessory be to determine whether the accessory be compatible with the device .#@#if the accessory be available on the Apple Online Store , see if you iPhone , iPad , or ipod touch model be list .#@#if you accessory use the 30-pin connector , you may be able to connect it to you device use the lightning to 30-pin adapter or lightning to 30-pin adapter -lrb- 0.2 m -rrb- . 186	iphone.txt	3	Accessory not working	Isolate Isolate the issue to the accessory, if possible. Or, if available, try to reproduce the issue with another identical or similar accessory. Examples: If there is static coming from the left audio channel when using headphones, try connecting the headphones to a stereo, or try connecting a different set of headphones to the device. 186	iphone.txt	5	Accessory not working	Restore iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch Restore iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch to its factory default state. 188	iphone.txt	6	Bluetooth headset isn't responding or working correctly with iPhone	In the Bluetooth settings pane, verify that the headset is discoverable. (For third-party Bluetooth headsets, refer to the manual for instructions on setup, headset discovery, and default security codes. For the Apple Bluetooth Headset, press and hold the headset button until you hear five quick, high beeps in the earpiece. The status light repeatedly flashes green when the headset is discoverable.) When the headset appears in the list of Bluetooth devices, tap to pair the iPhone with the headset. If the headset does not appear, ensure it is discoverable and not currently paired with another phone. If prompted by the iPhone, enter the security code "0000" and tap connect.	in the Bluetooth setting pane , verify that the headset be discoverable .#@#-lrb- for third-party Bluetooth headset , refer to the manual for instruction on setup , headset discovery , and default security code .#@#for the Apple Bluetooth Headset , press and hold the headset button until you hear five quick , high beep in the earpiece .#@#the status light repeatedly flash green when the headset be discoverable . -rrb-#@#when the headset appear in the list of Bluetooth device , tap to pair the iPhone with the headset .#@#if the headset do not appear , ensure it be discoverable and not currently pair with another phone .#@#if prompt by the iPhone , enter the security code `` 0000 '' and tap connect . 190	mac.txt	0	Connecting to the Internet	Check your modem Make sure that your modem is powered on and that its indicator lights (if any) display normally. If your modem has a standby light or button, make sure that your modem isn't in standby mode. If certain lights on your modem are off when they should be on, or they blink in a pattern, your ISP's network may be temporarily unavailable, there may be an issue with your computer connection, or you may simply need to restart your modem (see the next tip). Consult your modem's product manual for specifics about its status lights or call your ISP for more information. For additional information, see Troubleshooting a cable modem, DSL, or LAN Internet connection.	check you modem make sure that you modem be power on and that its indicator light -lrb- if any -rrb- display normally .#@#if you modem have a `` standby '' light or button , make sure that you modem be not in standby mode .#@#if certain light on you modem be off when they should be on , or they blink in a pattern , you isp 's network may be temporarily unavailable , there may be a issue with you computer connection , or you may simply need to restart you modem -lrb- see the next tip -rrb- .#@#consult you modem 's product manual for specifics about its status light or call you isp for more information .#@#for additional information , see troubleshoot a cable modem , dsl , or LAN Internet connection . 190	mac.txt	1	Connecting to the Internet	Restart your modem If you're using an external modemDSL, cable, or dial-uptry turning the modem off, waiting about 10 seconds, turning it back on, waiting for your modem to start up fully, and then connecting to a webpage to see if you can connect (if you're using a dial-up modem, be sure to connect to the Internet first before opening a webpage).	restart you modem if you be use a external modem -- dsl , cable , or dial-up -- try turn the modem off , wait about 10 seconds , turn it back on , wait for you modem to start up fully , and then connect to a webpage to see if you can connect -lrb- if you be use a dial-up modem , be sure to connect to the internet first before open a webpage -rrb- . 190	mac.txt	2	Connecting to the Internet	Use Network Diagnostics to troubleshoot .  If you're using Mac OS X and are having difficulty connecting to the Internet, use Network Diagnostics (in Network preferences), which will walk you through your connection, investigate trouble spots, and try to resolve the issue. From the Apple menu, choose System Preferences, click Network, click Assist Me at the bottom of the resulting window, and then click Diagnostics to start. 190	mac.txt	4	Connecting to the Internet	Check your connections and access Make sure that all of your Ethernet or phone cable connections are secure. Check the connection to your computer, the modem, and to any hub, router, or wireless base station you may be using. Try swapping your cable with another to rule out any faulty cable issues. If you're connecting wirelessly, make sure that the wireless network is up and running and that you actually have access to that networkyou may need a password or need to be added to an access control list by your MAC address (aka AirPort ID). For more information about joining an encrypted wireless network, see AirPort, Time Capsule: Joining an encrypted wireless network. If you connect to the Internet using a corporate or enterprise network (such as if you're at work) and can't access certain webpages or sites, the network may have a firewall that is preventing you from doing so. Contact your network administrator for more information and assistance.	check you connection and access make sure that all of you ethernet or phone cable connection be secure .#@#check the connection to you computer , the modem , and to any hub , router , or wireless base station you may be use .#@#try swap you cable with another to rule out any faulty cable issue .#@#if you be connect wirelessly , make sure that the wireless network be up and run and that you actually have access to that network -- you may need a password or need to be add to a access control list by you MAC address -lrb- aka AirPort ID -rrb- .#@#for more information about join a encrypted wireless network , see AirPort , Time Capsule : join a encrypted wireless network .#@#if you connect to the internet use a corporate or enterprise network -lrb- such as if you be at work -rrb- and can not access certain webpage or site , the network may have a firewall that be prevent you from do so .#@#contact you network administrator for more information and assistance . 190	mac.txt	5	Connecting to the Internet	Check your network status From the Apple menu, choose System Preferences and then click Network to display Network preferences. The status indicator for each port is color-coded. Green means the port is active (turned on) and connected. Red indicates the port is active but not connected. Make sure that the status indicator of the port through which your computer accesses the Internet is green. (With earlier Mac OS X versions, from the "Show" pop-up menu, choose Network Status to check the status of your network ports. If you don't see your port, make it active by choosing Network Port Configurations from the Show pop-up menu and selecting the appropriate checkbox for your connection.)	check you network status from 190	mac.txt	6	Connecting to the Internet	Check other websites, then your ISP or network To rule out issues with a particular website (a page may be temporarily unavailable or you may have entered the URL incorrectly), visit another webpage. If you can't connect to any page on any website, your ISP may be the one having trouble. Wait a moment and then try connecting to a site again. If you still can't connect after some time, call your ISP or network administrator to find out if there is an outage.	check other website , then you isp or network to rule out issue with a particular website -lrb- a page may be temporarily unavailable or you may have enter the url incorrectly -rrb- , visit another webpage .#@#if you can not connect to any page on any website , you isp may be the one have trouble .#@#wait a moment and then try connect to a site again .#@#if you still can not connect after some time , call you isp or network administrator to find out if there be a outage . 190	mac.txt	7	Connecting to the Internet	Check for DNS issues if you see alert messages If you see a message such as A connection failure has occurred, The specified server could not be found, or something similar when you try to connect to a website, there could be an issue with the DNS (Domain Name System) service, which converts DNS names (such as www.apple.com) into their IP address equivalents (for our Apple example, that would be 17.254.0.91). If you've already restarted your modem and have verified that your ISP or network is available, try the troubleshooting steps in Troubleshooting "A connection failure has occurred", "The specified server could not be found" or similar messages.	check for dn issue if you see alert message if you see a message such as `` a connection failure have occur , '' `` the specify server could not be find , '' or something similar when you try to connect to a website , there could be a issue with the dn -lrb- domain name System -rrb- service , which convert dn name -lrb- such as www.apple.com -rrb- into they IP address equivalent -lrb- for we Apple example , that would be 17.254.0.91 -rrb- .#@#if you have already restart you modem and have verify that you isp or network be available , try the troubleshooting step in troubleshoot `` a connection failure have occur '' , `` the specify server could not be find '' or similar message . 190	mac.txt	8	Connecting to the Internet	Call your dial-up number If you're using a dial-up modem, try dialing your ISP's modem number using a regular telephone to see if a modem answers. Check the line for static or other noise that might be interfering with the connection. To monitor your modem as it tries to connect, turn on your modem's sound in Network preferences.	call you dial-up number if you be use a dial-up modem , try dial you isp 's modem number use a regular telephone to see if a modem answer .#@#check the line for static or other noise that might be interfere with the connection .#@#to monitor you modem as it try to connect , turn on you modem 's sound in Network preference . If you need help using Network Utility, open the application, choose Network Utility Help from the Help menu, and then click See all Network Utility topics to find what you need. 191	mac.txt	0	Connecting to a wireless network via Wi-Fi	Make sure that Wi-Fi is on .  If you can't make a connection, check to make sure that Wi-Fi is on. The Wi-Fi menu bar icon (AirPort menu) should be bold and should state "Wi-Fi: On" or "Wi-Fi: Looking for Networks" at the top. If Wi-Fi is off, turn it on from the Wi-Fi menu.	make sure that wi-fus be on .#@#if you can not make a connection , check to make sure that wi-fus be on .#@#the Wi-Fi menu bar icon -lrb- AirPort menu -rrb- should be bold and should state `` Wi-Fi : on '' or `` Wi-Fi : look for Networks '' at the top .#@#if wi-fus be off , turn it on from the Wi-Fi menu . If your connection seems spotty, try moving closer to your base station. You can also check for potential sources of interference.	check you location the range of you wireless network can vary base on you environment .#@#if you connection seem spotty , try move closer to you base station .#@#you can also check for potential source of interference . 191	mac.txt	2	Connecting to a wireless network via Wi-Fi	Check your access privileges If you enabled encryption on your network, make sure that you set up your base station or router properly. Consult the documentation that came with your product. Make sure you're using the correct settings and password. If you're joining a closed network, a network with its name hidden, make sure that you've entered the network name and password correctly. If the network is secured by access control, make sure that your MAC address is registered with the network administrator. Consult the network administrator for assistance with access.	check you access privilege if you enable encryption on you network , make sure that you set up you base station or router properly .#@#consult the documentation that come with you product .#@#make sure you be use the correct setting and password .#@#if you be join a closed network , a network with its name hide , make sure that you have enter the network name and password correctly .#@#if the network be secure by access control , make sure that you MAC address be register with the network administrator .#@#consult the network administrator for assistance with access . 191	mac.txt	3	Connecting to a wireless network via Wi-Fi	Verify that your ISP is working If your Internet Service Provider's (ISP) servers are down, you won't be able to connect to the Internet. Use a web browser on any computer that's directly connected (by Ethernet) to make sure that your ISP is or is not responding. If you cannot connect, and have a separate broadband modem/router, try restarting it. If the issue persists, contact your ISP or wait for your service to be restored.	verify that you isp be work if you Internet Service Provider 's -lrb- isp -rrb- server be down , you will not be able to connect to the internet .#@#use a web browser on any computer that be directly connect -lrb- by ethernet -rrb- to make sure that you isp be or be not respond .#@#if you can not connect , and have a separate broadband modem/router , try restart it .#@#if the issue persist , contact you isp or wait for you service to be restore . 191	mac.txt	5	Connecting to a wireless network via Wi-Fi	Restart your base station or router .  Restart your home network router using the method recommended by its documentation. This may include disconnecting the power cord for 10 seconds or more. Note that any Internet services including a VoIP-based phone will not work until the router restarts.	restart you base station or router .#@#restart you home network router use the method recommend by its documentation .#@#this may include disconnect the power cord for 10 seconds or more .#@#note that any internet service include a voip-based phone will not work until the router restart . 191	mac.txt	6	Connecting to a wireless network via Wi-Fi	Update your firmware and software .  If you use an Wi-Fi base station, use Software Update to check for available updates. 192	mac.txt	0	Sending email	Use the Connection Doctor The Connection Doctor can check your server connections. In Mail, choose Connection Doctor from the Window menu. If it finds any trouble, it'll display a red Status indicator next to the problematic account and provide some information and advice in the Details column. If you see a red indicator, follow the doctor's advice to try and fix the issue. See Troubleshooting sending and receiving email for more information.	use the connection doctor the connection doctor can check you server connection .#@#in Mail , choose connection doctor from the Window menu .#@#if it find any trouble , it 'll display a red status indicator next to the problematic account and provide some information and advice in the detail column .#@#if you see a red indicator , follow the doctor 's advice to try and fix the issue .#@#see troubleshoot send and receive email for more information . 192	mac.txt	2	Sending email	Make sure that you're not being blocked by a firewall If you or a network administrator has a firewall blocking email traffic on port 25, 465, or 587, you may not be able to send email. If you've installed third-party firewall software in Mac OS X, try temporarily disabling it to see if you can send email. There may also be firewall software built into your Internet router, or a router administered by your ISP or network administrator. Contact the appropriate person to find out if a firewall exists.	make sure that you be not be block by a firewall if you or a network administrator have a firewall block email traffic on port 25 , 465 , or 587 , you may not be able to send email .#@#if you have install third-party firewall software in Mac OS X , try temporarily disable it to see if you can send email .#@#there may also be firewall software build into you internet router , or a router administer by you isp or network administrator .#@#contact the appropriate person to find out if a firewall exist . 192	mac.txt	3	Sending email	Send yourself an email If you can send email from your account but you're not sure if you can receive any, send yourself an email. Your message will go out through your outgoing mail server and back in through your incoming mail server. After sending yourself a test email, wait a minute or so for the servers to send the data, then click Get Mail. If you don't get your own email after waiting about 15 minutes, try these other tips.	send yourself a email if you can send email from you account but you be not sure if you can receive any , send yourself a email .#@#you message will go out through you outgoing mail server and back in through you incoming mail server .#@#after send yourself a test email , wait a minute or so for the server to send the datum , then click get Mail .#@#if you do not get you own email after wait about 15 minute , try these other tip . 192	mac.txt	4	Sending email	See if your account is using the email servers To check if all servers are in use by your accounts, open Mail preferences, click Accounts, then click Account Information. From the Outgoing Mail Server (SMTP) pop-up menu, choose Edit Server List to display a list of servers. If you see an entry in the In Use By Account column for a server, that server is in use. If you have any servers listed that don't have an entry in this column, select the server, click Remove Server, and then click Done. If you see that your affected account isn't In Use, reset your server settings.	see if you account be use the email server to check if all server be in use by you account , open Mail preference , click Accounts , then click Account Information .#@#from the Outgoing Mail server -lrb- smtp -rrb- pop-up menu , choose Edit server list to display a list of server .#@#if you see a entry in the `` in Use by Account '' column for a server , that server be in use .#@#if you have any server list that do not have a entry in this column , select the server , click remove server , and then click do .#@#if you see that you affect account be not `` in use , '' reset you server setting . 192	mac.txt	5	Sending email	Make sure that your email account isn't offline If Mail can't connect to and access your account's incoming server when it checks for messages, it will take your account offline. Take a look at your Inbox icon. If it appears dimmed or you see an exclamation point or tilde-looking icon (~) next to it or one of your account names (if you have more than one account), try taking it back online. Click the icon to the right of the affected account's name or select the account and choose Mailbox > Online Status > Take account name Online.	make sure that you email account be not offline if Mail can not connect to and access you account 's incoming server when it check for message , it will take you account offline .#@#take a look at you inbox icon .#@#if it appear dim or you see a exclamation point or tilde-looking icon -lrb- ~ -rrb- next to it or one of you account name -lrb- if you have more than one account -rrb- , try take it back online .#@#click the icon to the right of the affect account 's name or select the account and choose mailbox > Online Status > take `` account name '' online . 193	mac.txt	0	Manually installing new software and updates	Make sure you have enough disk space If you're installing new software, the installation may require a significant amount of space on your hard drive. Check the software's installation requirements to find out how much space is needed, and confirm that your Mac has enough available space on its hard drive before installing. To find out how much space you've got left, double-click your hard drive icon to open a Finder window; your available disk space should appear at the bottom of the window.	make sure you have enough disk space if you be install new software , the installation may require a significant amount of space on you hard drive .#@#check the software 's installation requirement to find out how much space be need , and confirm that you mac have enough available space on its hard drive before install .#@#to find out how much space you have get left , double-click you hard drive icon to open a finder window ; you available disk space should appear at the bottom of the window . 193	mac.txt	1	Manually installing new software and updates	Verify that you have administrative access You need to be an administrator of the computer to install or update software. If you're the one who first set up the computer, you are the administrator. If someone set up your computer for you and your own username and password aren't allowing you to install software, consult that person for assistance. If you've forgotten your administrator password, see Mac OS X: Changing or resetting an account password.	verify that you have administrative access you need to be a administrator of the computer to install or update software .#@#if you be the one who first set up the computer , you be the administrator .#@#if someone set up you computer for you and you own username and password be not allow you to install software , consult that person for assistance .#@#if you have forget you administrator password , see Mac OS x : change or reset a account password . 193	mac.txt	2	Manually installing new software and updates	Make sure that you're entering the serial number / code correctly Some software installers require that you enter a serial number or software key (or code) during the installation. You can usually find the number or key printed on the installer disc, disc case, in the manual, or on a certificate provided with the software. If you downloaded the software, the key may be sent in a separate email. You should make note of the number or key before installing the software and be sure to enter the code correctly. If the code is not accepted, make sure you use the numeral 1 or the letter I as appropriate, the number 0 (zero) and the letter O as appropriate, the number 5 for the letter S as appropriate, and so forth.	make sure that you be enter the serial number / code correctly some software installer require that you enter a serial number or software key -lrb- or code -rrb- during the installation .#@#you can usually find the number or key print on the installer disc , disc case , in the manual , or on a certificate provide with the software .#@#if you download the software , the key may be send in a separate email .#@#you should make note of the number or key before install the software and be sure to enter the code correctly .#@#if the code be not accept , make sure you use the numeral 1 or the letter I as appropriate , the number 0 -lrb- zero -rrb- and the letter O as appropriate , the number 5 for the letter s as appropriate , and so forth . 193	mac.txt	4	Manually installing new software and updates	Check the disc on another Mac If an installer on a DVD or CD won't open on your Mac or the disc doesn't appear on your desktop, try the disc with another Mac. If it opens elsewhere, use System Profiler to verify that the computer's DVD drive is recognized by the system. Some older drives may only read CDs. Otherwise, your disc drive may need repair (test your disc drive's performance with other CDs and DVDs first before seeking service). If the disc doesn't work on another computer, there could be something wrong with the disccontact the software developer for assistance or replacement.	check the disc on another Mac if a installer on a dvd or cd will not open on you mac or the disc do not appear on you desktop , try the disc with another Mac .#@#if it open elsewhere , use System Profiler to verify that the computer 's dvd drive be recognize by the system .#@#some older drive may only read cd .#@#otherwise , you disc drive may need repair -lrb- test you disc drive 's performance with other cd and dvd first before seek service -rrb- .#@#if the disc do not work on another computer , there could be something wrong with the disc -- contact the software developer for assistance or replacement . 193	mac.txt	5	Manually installing new software and updates	Make sure that your Internet connection is working for Software Update If your Internet connection or network is down, Software Update won't be able to access the Internet to do its job. Try again later when your connection is back up and running. If you're connected to a network, make sure that your computer is allowed to access Internet locationsconsult with your network administrator to find an alternate location to access Software Update or to get information about the proxy server your network uses to access the Internet.	make sure that you internet connection be work for Software Update if you internet connection or network be down , Software Update will not be able to access the internet to do its job .#@#try again later when you connection be back up and run .#@#if you be connect to a network , make sure that you computer be allow to access internet location -- consult with you network administrator to find a alternate location to access Software Update or to get information about the proxy server you network use to access the internet . 193	mac.txt	6	Manually installing new software and updates	Download the application again If you're trying to install from a download, visit the software developer's site and download the installer file again. There could be an issue with your original download and a fresh copy may resolve the issue.	download the application again if you be try to install from a download , visit the software developer 's site and download the installer file again .#@#there could be a issue with you original download and a fresh copy may resolve the issue . 193	mac.txt	7	Manually installing new software and updates	Make sure that you've got the right updater or upgrader If you're updating or upgrading software, make sure that the version you downloaded or bought is truly the one you need. Some updates require that you install another update before you can install the latest one. Some upgrades will only upgrade certain versions of an application, which may not be the one you have. Check the developer's website or any included Read Me file for installation requirements and other useful information.	make sure that you have get the right updater or upgrader if you be update or upgrade software , make sure that the version you download or buy be truly the one you need .#@#some update require that you install another update before you can install the latest one .#@#some upgrade will only upgrade certain version of a application , which may not be the one you have .#@#check the developer 's website or any include `` Read I '' file for installation requirement and other useful information . 193	mac.txt	8	Manually installing new software and updates	Try removing application receipts If you're reinstalling an application or updating an existing one, try removing the application's receipts. Look for any receipts that bear the name of the application in the the Receipts folder inside of the main Library folder (/Library/Receipts) and move them elsewhere. Then try installing or updating your software again.	try remove application receipt if you be reinstall a application or update a exist one , try remove the application 's receipt .#@#look for any receipt that bear the name of the application in the the Receipts folder inside of the main Library folder -lrb- / library/receipts -rrb- and move they elsewhere .#@#then try install or update you software again . If your replacement power cord or power adapter resolves the issue, you may want to replace the original. For portable products, make sure the power adapter you try is compatible.	try a different cord or power adapter to find out if you have a faulty cord or power adapter , swap you power cord or power adapter for another if you have a work one available .#@#if you replacement power cord or power adapter resolve the issue , you may want to replace the original .#@#for portable product , make sure the power adapter you try be compatible . 194	mac.txt	5	Turning on an apple product	Make Sure That It's Not a Video Issue When you try to start up your computer, do you hear the startup sound, hard drive noise, and fan noise? If so, your computer may have a video issue instead. Check your display to make sure that it's working properly. Try turning up the brightness on the display itself (for portable computers press and hold F2 for 3-4 seconds). If you stick your eyeball up close to it and can just make out your desktop image, you may need to get your display serviced. Try connecting a different display to see if that solves the issue, if you have one available. For more information about video issues and some troubleshooting steps, see this article.	make Sure that it be not a Video Issue when you try to start up you computer , do you hear the startup sound , hard drive noise , and fan noise ?#@#if so , you computer may have a video issue instead .#@#check you display to make sure that it be work properly .#@#try turn up the brightness on the display itself -lrb- for portable computer press and hold f2 for 3-4 seconds -rrb- .#@#if you stick you eyeball up close to it and can just make out you desktop image , you may need to get you display service .#@#try connect a different display to see if that solve the issue , if you have one available .#@#for more information about video issue and some troubleshooting step , see this article .
