194	mac.txt	6	Turning on an apple product	Check New Installations If you just installed more memory or a new AirPort card, an improper installation can cause your computer not to start up properly. Unplug your computer and make sure that your memory chip or AirPort card is fully seated in its slot. Try removing it and then reseating it just to make sure. For more information, consult the documentation that came with your product or choose your computer from the pop-up menu under Installing DIY Parts on the Do It Yourself Parts & Service page to find instructions (in PDF format) for installing AirPort cards and memory into your computer. If you still can't turn on your computer, remove your new addition (and replace it with the original if needed) to see if your computer starts up. If it does, contact the device's manufacturer for assistance.	check New Installations if you just install more memory or a new AirPort card , a improper installation can cause you computer not to start up properly .#@#unplug you computer and make sure that you memory chip or airport card be fully seat in its slot .#@#try remove it and then reseat it just to make sure .#@#for more information , consult the documentation that come with you product or choose you computer from the pop-up menu under `` Installing DIY Parts '' on the Do it Yourself Parts & Service page to find instruction -lrb- in pdf format -rrb- for install AirPort card and memory into you computer .#@#if you still can not turn on you computer , remove you new addition -lrb- and replace it with the original if need -rrb- to see if you computer start up .#@#if it do , contact the device 's manufacturer for assistance . 194	mac.txt	7	Turning on an apple product	Disconnect Your Devices There could be a conflict between one of your devices and your Mac. To rule out a device conflict, disconnect all of your external devices and then try turning on your computer again. If your Mac powers up, isolate which device is causing the issue by connecting a device, restarting your computer, and testing it before connecting the next device. If your computer won't start up after connecting a device, that device is likely the cause of the issue. Contact the device manufacturer for assistance.	disconnect you Devices there could be a conflict between one of you device and you mac .#@#to rule out a device conflict , disconnect all of you external device and then try turn on you computer again .#@#if you Mac power up , isolate which device be cause the issue by connect a device , restart you computer , and testing it before connect the next device .#@#if you computer will not start up after connect a device , that device be likely the cause of the issue .#@#contact the device manufacturer for assistance . 194	mac.txt	8	Turning on an apple product	Reset Your Computer's SMU or PMU Important: Please note, for most situations, a restart is sufficient. If the computer has stopped responding, try these steps, in order, until the computer responds: Force Quit (Option-Command-Escape) Restart (Control-Command-Power) Force Shut Down (press the power button for 10 seconds) Only perform a reset on the computer if none of the above steps resolved the situation. To reset your computer's System Management Controller (SMC), System Management Unit (SMU) or Power Management Unit (PMU), select the appropriate article below for instructions: Resetting the SMU on an iMac Resetting the SMU on a Power Mac G5 Resetting the SMC on a MacBook or MacBook Pro Resetting the PMU on a PowerBook or iBook Resetting the PMU on Mac mini	Reset you computer 's SMU or PMU 196	mac.txt	1	USB printer troubleshooting for AirPort Express, AirPort Extreme, and AirPort Time Capsule	Disconnect and reconnect Disconnect the AirPort Express, AirPort Extreme or AirPort Time Capsule from a power outlet Turn off the printer. Be sure the USB cable from the printer is connected to the AirPort Express, AirPort Extreme or AirPort Time Capsule. Turn on the printer. 196	mac.txt	4	USB printer troubleshooting for AirPort Express, AirPort Extreme, and AirPort Time Capsule	Reset Printing System Use these steps on your Mac if the above steps do not help. Open System Preferences > Print & Fax preferences. Control-click or right-click in the Printers section on the left. Choose Reset printing system. Click OK. Click the + button to add your printer again. Try to print. 197	mac.txt	0	USB and Firewire	Check the connections If you're using a cable, make sure that both ends of the cable are properly and securely connected to your device and Mac. Try unplugging your device and then plugging it back in. If you're connecting a FireWire device, make sure that the cable is no more than 15 feet (4.5 meters) long. If you're connecting a USB device, make sure that the cable is no more than 16 feet long. If you're making a direct connection, make sure that the device's connector is fully seated in your computer's port. If your device also connects to a power outlet, make sure it has power.	check the connection if you be use a cable , make sure that both end of the cable be properly and securely connect to you device and mac .#@#try unplug you device and then plug it back in .#@#if you be connect a firewire device , make sure that the cable be no more than 15 foot -lrb- 4.5 meter -rrb- long .#@#if you be connect a usb device , make sure that the cable be no more than 16 foot long .#@#if you be make a direct connection , make sure that the device 's connector be fully seat in you computer 's port .#@#if you device also connect to a power outlet , make sure it have power . 197	mac.txt	2	USB and Firewire	Check your device's power If the device has a power switch, make sure it is on. Try turning your device off and then on again. Some devices require more power that the bus supplies. If your device came with an external power adapter, always connect it to a power source in for the best performance from your device.	check you device 's power if the device have a power switch , make sure it be on .#@#try turn you device off and then on again .#@#some device require more power that the bus supplies .#@#if you device come with a external power adapter , always connect it to a power source in for the best performance from you device . (ROOT (S (VP (VB Check) (SBAR (S (NP (NP (PRP$ your) (NN device) (POS 's)) (NN power)) (VP (VBP Make) (ADJP (JJ sure) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (PRP$ your) (NN device)) (VP (VBZ is) (PP (IN on) (SBAR (IN if) (S (NP (PRP it)) (VP (VBZ has) (NP (NP (DT a) (NN power) (NN switch)) (: ;) (VP (VP (VB try) (S (VP (VBG turning) (NP (PRP$ your) (NN device)) (PRT (IN off))))) (CC and) (VP (ADVP (RB then)) (PP (IN on) (ADVP (RB again)))))))))))))))))) (. .)))	check you device 's power make sure that you device be on if it have a power switch ; try turn you device off and then on again
197	mac.txt	6	USB and Firewire	Try a different port and cable Connect your device to a different USB or FireWire port on your Mac. If you connected your device to a USB or FireWire hub or to a port on another USB or FireWire device that's connected to your Mac (known as daisy chaining), connect your device directly to a port on your computer. Some devices need to draw power from a USB or FireWire port to work; if you connect a device to a non-powered hub (one that isn't plugged in to a power source) or to a low-power port (such as the one on your USB keyboard), it may not work. If you have another known-good cable, try swapping the cable to see if that works. If it does, you should replace the problematic cable.	try a different port and cable connect you device to a different usb or FireWire port on you mac .#@#if you connected you device to a usb or FireWire hub or to a port on another usb or firewire device that be connect to you mac -lrb- know as daisy chaining -rrb- , connect you device directly to a port on you computer .#@#some device need to draw power from a usb or FireWire port to work ; if you connect a device to a non-powered hub -lrb- one that be not plug in to a power source -rrb- or to a low-power port -lrb- such as the one on you usb keyboard -rrb- , it may not work .#@#if you have another known-good cable , try swap the cable to see if that work .#@#if it do , you should replace the problematic cable . 197	mac.txt	7	USB and Firewire	Check for device conflicts Disconnect all USB or FireWire devices (including hubs and extension cables) except for your Apple keyboard and mouse. Then, connect the device in question directly to your computer. If your device works now, there may be a conflict between that device and one of your other USB or FireWire devices. If it doesn't work, go to tip 8. If you do have a conflict, you can determine which devices are affected. Connect your other devices to your Mac, one by one, making sure to test that each device works before making another connection. When you find the device that causes the issue, contact the manufacturer for assistance (check both manufacturers' websites for software updates and additional information).	check for device conflict disconnect all usb or firewire device -lrb- include hub and extension cable -rrb- except for you Apple keyboard and mouse .#@#then , connect the device in question directly to you computer .#@#if you device work now , there may be a conflict between that device and one of you other usb or firewire device .#@#if it do not work , go to tip 8 .#@#if you do have a conflict , you can determine which device be affect .#@#connect you other device to you Mac , one by one , make sure to test that each device work before make another connection .#@#when you find the device that cause the issue , contact the manufacturer for assistance -lrb- check both manufacturer ' website for software update and additional information -rrb- . 197	mac.txt	9	USB and Firewire	Try another user account or computer If you have another Mac available, try connecting your device to that other computer to see if it works. If you don't have another computer available, log in to another user account on your Mac (or create a new user account and log in to it), and test the device again. If the device is working now, there may be a software conflict between the device and something in your original user account.	try another user account or computer if you have another Mac available , try connect you device to that other computer to see if it work .#@#if you do not have another computer available , log in to another user account on you mac -lrb- or create a new user account and log in to it -rrb- , and test the device again .#@#if the device be work now , there may be a software conflict between the device and something in you original user account . 197	mac.txt	10	USB and Firewire	Check System Profiler for hardware Issues Open System Profiler (from the Apple menu, choose About This Mac, then click More Info) and then click either USB or FireWire. If you don't see your device listed in the pane, the issue could be with the device itself or your computer's USB or FireWire port. To rule out the port, plug the device into another USB or FireWire port on your Mac and then check System Profiler again (press Command-R to refresh the window). Also try resetting the FireWire bus. If you see your device listed in the pane but it doesn't work, you may want to contact the device's manufacturer for assistance.	check System Profiler for hardware issue open System Profiler -lrb- from the Apple menu , choose about this mac , then click more info -rrb- and then click either usb or FireWire .#@#if you do not see you device list in the pane , the issue could be with the device itself or you computer 's usb or FireWire port .#@#to rule out the port , plug the device into another usb or FireWire port on you mac and then check System Profiler again -lrb- press command-r to refresh the window -rrb- .#@#also try reset the FireWire bus .#@#if you see you device list in the pane but it do not work , you may want to contact the device 's manufacturer for assistance . 198	mac.txt	0	Burning a disc	If a burn does not succeed, check the disc or try another disc Eject the disc from the drive and inspect it to see if the surface is dirty or scratched, or if it already has data written on it (the shiny surface is slightly darker where data has already been burned). If it's dirty, wipe it clean with a soft, damp cloth and try burning again. If the disc already contains data, try another disc. If you're using a rewritable disc that already contains data, be sure to erase it before burning data on it again. Small flaws or surface inconsistencies can cause an unsuccessful burn. Try burning your content to another disc or try a different brand of disc (if possible).	if a burn do not succeed , check the disc or try another disc eject the disc from the drive and inspect it to see if the surface be dirty or scratch , or if it already have datum write on it -lrb- the shiny surface be slightly darker where datum have already be burn -rrb- .#@#if it be dirty , wipe it clean with a soft , damp cloth and try burning again .#@#if the disc already contain datum , try another disc .#@#if you be use a rewritable disc that already contain datum , be sure to erase it before burn datum on it again .#@#small flaw or surface inconsistency can cause a unsuccessful burn .#@#try burning you content to another disc or try a different brand of disc -lrb- if possible -rrb- . 198	mac.txt	2	Burning a disc	Check the disc type Make sure that your disc drive is capable of writing to your media at hand. For example, you won't be able to burn a DVD+RW disc with an older Apple SuperDrive. Consult your Apple or third-party product manual for your drive's supported media specifications. You should also use discs that are rated for the burn speed of your drive.	check the disc type make sure that you disc drive be capable of write to you media at hand .#@#for example , you will not be able to burn a DVD+RW disc with a older Apple SuperDrive .#@#consult you Apple or third-party product manual for you drive 's support media specification .#@#you should also use disc that be rate for the burn speed of you drive . 198	mac.txt	3	Burning a disc	Slow things down In the Burn dialog, specify a burn speed that is slower than the maximum speed rating for your disc drive (if you can) and try burning another disc.	slow thing down in the Burn dialog , specify a burn speed that be slower than the maximum speed rating for you disc drive -lrb- if you can -rrb- and try burn another disc . 198	mac.txt	4	Burning a disc	Free up some memory If you've got other applications open, quit the ones that you're not using (or quit them all except for the one from which you're burning your disc). Allow the disc to burn before doing other things on your computer.	free up some memory if you have get other application open , quit the one that you be not use -lrb- or quit they all except for the one from which you be burn you disc -rrb- .#@#allow the disc to burn before do other thing on you computer . 198	mac.txt	5	Burning a disc	Check your hard drive's available space When you burn a disc, your Mac temporarily sets aside an amount of hard disk space equal to the amount of data being burned to the disc. If you're burning a large amount of data, you may run out of room on your hard disk if it's almost full, which may prevent a disc from burning. To free up space, throw out unwanted files or back up files to an external drive.	check you hard drive 's available space when you burn a disc , you Mac temporarily set aside a amount of hard disk space equal to the amount of datum be burn to the disc .#@#if you be burn a large amount of datum , you may run out of room on you hard disk if it be almost full , which may prevent a disc from burning .#@#to free up space , throw out unwanted file or back up file to a external drive . 199	mac.txt	0	Bluetooth	Make sure that you have Bluetooth Make sure that your computer has Bluetooth built-in or that a compatible Bluetooth adapter is connected. Open System Preferences (from the Apple menu, choose System Preferences), then choose Bluetooth from the View menu. If you're using a USB Bluetooth adapter, make sure that you connect it directly to a USB port on your computernot to a port on your keyboard, display, or USB hub.	make sure that you have Bluetooth Make sure that you computer have Bluetooth built-in or that a compatible Bluetooth adapter be connect .#@#Open System Preferences -lrb- from the Apple menu , choose System Preferences -rrb- , then choose Bluetooth from the View menu .#@#if you be use a usb Bluetooth adapter , make sure that you connect it directly to a usb port on you computer -- not to a port on you keyboard , display , or usb hub . 199	mac.txt	2	Bluetooth	Make sure that Bluetooth and your device are turned on To check your computer's Bluetooth status, choose System Preferences from the Apple menu, then click Bluetooth. In Bluetooth preferences, make sure "On" is selected (in earlier Mac OS X versions, click the Settings tab, then click the Bluetooth On button to turn on Bluetooth). Check your device to make sure that it's also powered on. If you're trying to pair a Bluetooth phone or PDA, make sure that Bluetooth is active and that the device is discoverable (consult your product manual if you're unsure about how to change these settings on your device).	make sure that Bluetooth and you device be turn on to check you computer 's Bluetooth status , choose System Preferences from the Apple menu , then click Bluetooth .#@#in Bluetooth preference , make sure `` On '' be select -lrb- in earlier Mac OS X version , click the setting tab , then click the Bluetooth on button to turn on Bluetooth -rrb- .#@#check you device to make sure that it be also power on .#@#if you be try to pair a Bluetooth phone or pda , make sure that Bluetooth be active and that the device be `` discoverable '' -lrb- consult you product manual if you be unsure about how to change these setting on you device -rrb- . 199	mac.txt	3	Bluetooth	Verify that you've set up your device with your computer If you're trying to pair a phone or handheld device with your computer, open System Preferences and click Bluetooth (and click the Devices tab in earlier Mac OS X versions). You should see your device listed. If not, follow the instructions for Syncing Bluetooth devices with your Mac above. To set up an Apple Wireless Keyboard and Mouse in earlier Mac OS X versions, open System Preferences, click Keyboard & Mouse, click the Bluetooth tab, and then click Set Up New Device to open the Bluetooth Setup Assistant. Follow the onscreen instructions to set up your keyboard and mouse. Some older versions of Mac OS X, include Bluetooth Setup Assistant in the Utilities folder (/Applications/Utilities) to help with pairing issues.	verify that you have set up you device with you computer if you be try to pair a phone or handheld device with you computer , open System Preferences and click Bluetooth -lrb- and click the Devices tab in earlier Mac OS X version -rrb- .#@#you should see you device list .#@#if not , follow the instruction for synce Bluetooth device with you mac above .#@#to set up a Apple Wireless Keyboard and mouse in earlier Mac OS X version , open System Preferences , click Keyboard & Mouse , click the Bluetooth tab , and then click `` set up New Device '' to open the Bluetooth Setup Assistant .#@#follow the onscreen instruction to set up you keyboard and mouse .#@#some older version of Mac OS X , include Bluetooth Setup Assistant in the Utilities folder -lrb- / applications/utilities -rrb- to help with pair issue . 199	mac.txt	4	Bluetooth	Recharge or replace your Bluetooth device's battery If your Bluetooth device's battery is low, you may experience connection issues. Depending on the type of device you have, try charging your battery (if your device has a rechargeable battery) or replacing disposable batteries with fresh ones.	recharge or replace you bluetooth device 's battery if you bluetooth device 's battery be low , you may experience connection issue .#@#depend on the type of device you have , try charge you battery -lrb- if you device have a rechargeable battery -rrb- or replace disposable battery with fresh one . 199	mac.txt	5	Bluetooth	Download and install the latest software for the device Some Bluetooth devices require you to install software before you can use them with your Mac. Make sure that you've installed any required software or that you're using the latest software available for the device on your computer. Check the device manufacturer's website for the latest updates and more information. For help with syncing a Palm OS device with your Mac over Bluetooth, see iSync 2: How to sync a Palm OS device over Bluetooth.	download and install the latest software for the device some Bluetooth device require you to install software before you can use they with you mac .#@#make sure that you have install any require software or that you be use the latest software available for the device on you computer .#@#check the device manufacturer 's website for the latest update and more information .#@#for help with synce a Palm OS device with you mac over Bluetooth , see isync 2 : how to sync a Palm OS device over Bluetooth . 199	mac.txt	6	Bluetooth	Check for a Bluetooth update To check for new software, choose Software Update from the Apple menu (make sure that your computer is connected to the Internet). If newer Apple Bluetooth software exists, Software Update will prompt you to install it. To install an update, select the checkbox next to the software name and then click Install.	check for a Bluetooth update to check for new software , choose Software Update from the Apple menu -lrb- make sure that you computer be connect to the internet -rrb- .#@#if newer Apple Bluetooth software exist , Software Update will prompt you to install it .#@#to install a update , select the checkbox next to the software name and then click Install . 199	mac.txt	7	Bluetooth	Reduce potential signal interference Because Bluetooth works by transmitting signals through the air, some things can interfere with connections. Avoid situations in which metal objects come between your device and computer. Don't put your computer under a metal desk or in a metal cabinet. Keep your computer away from cordless phone base stations, microwave ovens, and other electrical devices that operate on a 2.4 GHz bandwidth. Make sure that your device and computer aren't more than 30 feet apart from each other.	reduce potential signal interference because Bluetooth work by transmit signal through the air , some thing can interfere with connection .#@#avoid situation in which metal object come between you device and computer .#@#do not put you computer under a metal desk or in a metal cabinet .#@#keep you computer away from cordless phone base station , microwave oven , and other electrical device that operate on a 2.4 GHz bandwidth .#@#make sure that you device and computer be not more than 30 foot apart from each other .	VB JJ NN NN IN NNP VBZ IN VBG NNS IN DT NN , DT NNS MD VB IN NNS .#@#VB NNS IN WDT NN NNS VBP IN PRP$ NN CC NN .#@#VBP RB VB PRP$ NN IN DT NN NN CC IN DT NN NN .#@#VB PRP$ NN RB IN JJ NN NN NNS , NN NNS , CC JJ JJ NNS WDT VBP IN DT CD NNP NN .#@#VB JJ IN PRP$ NN CC NN VBP RB JJR IN CD NNS RB IN DT JJ .	(ROOT (S (S (VP (VB Reduce) (NP (JJ potential) (NN signal) (NN interference)) (SBAR (IN Because) (S (NP (NNP Bluetooth)) (VP (VBZ works) (PP (IN by) (S (VP (VBG transmitting) (NP (NNS signals)) (PP (IN through) (NP (DT the) (NN air))))))))))) (, ,) (NP (DT some) (NNS things)) (VP (MD can) (VP (VB interfere) (PP (IN with) (NP (NNS connections))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (VP (VB Avoid) (NP (NP (NNS situations)) (SBAR (WHPP (IN in) (WHNP (WDT which) (NN metal))) (S (NP (NNS objects)) (VP (VBP come) (PP (IN between) (NP (PRP$ your) (NN device) (CC and) (NN computer)))))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (VP (VBP Do) (RB n't) (VP (VB put) (NP (PRP$ your) (NN computer)) (PP (PP (IN under) (NP (DT a) (NN metal) (NN desk))) (CC or) (PP (IN in) (NP (DT a) (NN metal) (NN cabinet)))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (VP (VB Keep) (NP (PRP$ your) (NN computer)) (ADVP (RB away)) (PP (IN from) (NP (NP (JJ cordless) (NN phone) (NN base) (NNS stations)) (, ,) (NP (NN microwave) (NNS ovens)) (, ,) (CC and) (NP (NP (JJ other) (JJ electrical) (NNS devices)) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (VP (VBP operate) (PP (IN on) (NP (DT a) (CD 2.4) (NNP GHz) (NN bandwidth)))))))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (VP (VB Make) (ADJP (JJ sure)) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (PRP$ your) (NN device) (CC and) (NN computer)) (VP (VBP are) (RB n't) (ADVP (NP (QP (XS (JJR more) (IN than)) (CD 30)) (NNS feet)) (RB apart) (PP (IN from) (NP (DT each) (JJ other)))))))) (. .)))	reduce potential signal interference because bluetooth work by transmit signal through the air some thing can interfere with connection avoid situation in which metal object come between you device and computer do not put you computer under a metal desk or in a metal cabinet keep you computer away from cordless phone base station microwave oven and other electrical device that operate on a    ghz bandwidth make sure that you device and computer be not more than NUM foot apart from each other

You may also want to try resetting your computer's PRAM and NVRAM. Reset your Bluetooth device Try turning your device off and then on again. If that doesn't resolve the issue, see if you can reset your devicerefer to the documentation that came with your device for instructions.	restart you computer sometimes a simple restart of you mac be all it take to get thing run smoothly again .#@#you may also want to try reset you computer 's PRAM and NVRAM .#@#reset you bluetooth device try turn you device off and then on again .#@#if that do not resolve the issue , see if you can reset you device -- refer to the documentation that come with you device for instruction . 200	microsoft.txt	0	game software and driver issues	Check for known issues and updates for the game. Most software problems are not unique, and when you encounter one, it's likely that other people are having the same problem. Frequently, game publishers will issue updates that contain fixes to known problems. To learn more about known issues and to get updates for games and devices, visit the game publisher's or device manufacturer's website.	check for known issue and update for the game .#@#most software problem be not unique , and when you encounter one , it be likely that other people be have the same problem .#@#frequently , game publisher will issue update that contain fix to known problem .#@#to learn more about known issue and to get update for game and device , visit the game publisher 's or device manufacturer 's website . 200	microsoft.txt	1	game software and driver issues	Update Microsoft DirectX. DirectX is a software technology that helps create the special visual and audio effects that come with games. Many games rely on DirectX to help get more performance from your computer. Make sure that you have the latest version of DirectX so that you can take advantage of all of the latest features. For information about making sure that you have the latest version of DirectX, see Which version of DirectX is on your computer? 201	microsoft.txt	1	game hardware issues	Disable your joystick. If you are using a joystick, make sure it is not the source of the problem. To do so, shut down your computer, unplug the joystick, restart the computer, and then test the game using your keyboard. If the issue does not appear, contact the joystick manufacturer to continue to troubleshoot the issue.	disable you joystick .#@#if you be use a joystick , make sure it be not the source of the problem .#@#to do so , shut down you computer , unplug the joystick , restart the computer , and then test the game use you keyboard .#@#if the issue do not appear , contact the joystick manufacturer to continue to troubleshoot the issue . 201	microsoft.txt	2	game hardware issues	Temporarily disable the sound card. Disabling the sound card will help you determine if the sound card is the cause of the problem. To temporarily disable your sound card, follow these steps: You must be logged on as an administrator to perform these steps. Open Device Manager by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking System and Maintenance, and then clicking Device Manager. .  If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation. Expand the Sound, video, and game controllers section. Right-click your sound card in the list, and then click Disable. If disabling the sound card resolves this issue, contact your computer manufacturer for more troubleshooting steps.	temporarily disable the sound card .#@#disable the sound card will help you determine if the sound card be the cause of the problem .#@#to temporarily disable you sound card , follow these step : you must be log on as a administrator to perform these step .#@#open Device Manager by click the Start button , click Control Panel , click System and Maintenance , and then click Device Manager .#@#.#@#if you be prompt for a administrator password or confirmation , type the password or provide confirmation .#@#expand the sound , video , and game controller section .#@#right-click you sound card in the list , and then click Disable .#@#if disable the sound card resolve this issue , contact you computer manufacturer for more troubleshooting step . 202	microsoft.txt	0	What can I do about video problems, such as green or pink lines appearing in the video, flickering or choppy video, the Player stops responding when playing video, and so on?	If the problem affects all or most of the video files you play (as opposed to just a few specific files), the driver software for your video card (also known as a display adapter, video adapter, graphics adapter, or graphics board) might be out-of-date. Check for updates for the driver software for your video card and for updates to Microsoft DirectX by doing the following. Open Windows Update by clicking the Start button , clicking All Programs, and then clicking Windows Update. In the left pane, click Check for updates, and then wait while Windows looks for the latest updates for your computer. If any updates are found, click Install updates. If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation.	if the problem affect all or most of the video file you play -lrb- as oppose to just a few specific file -rrb- , the driver software for you video card -lrb- also know as a display adapter , video adapter , graphic adapter , or graphic board -rrb- might be out-of-date .#@#check for update for the driver software for you video card and for update to Microsoft DirectX by do the follow .#@#open Windows Update by click the Start button , click all program , and then click Windows Update .#@#in the left pane , click check for update , and then wait while Windows look for the latest update for you computer .#@#if any update be find , click Install update .#@#if you be prompt for a administrator password or confirmation , type the password or provide confirmation . If updating your driver software doesn't solve the problem, try reducing (or turning off) video hardware acceleration by doing the following. Open Display Settings by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Appearance and Personalization, clicking Personalization, and then clicking Display Settings. Click Advanced Settings, click the Troubleshoot tab, and then click Change settings. Note that some video card drivers do not permit you to change settings. 203	microsoft.txt	0	Why can't I play, burn, or sync protected files that I downloaded from an online store?	You copied the protected file from one computer to another and the online store has not issued you new media usage rights (also known as a license) for the second computer. In some cases, you might be able to resolve the problem by connecting to the Internet, signing in to your online store, and then attempting to play the file. In other cases, you might need to download the file again from the online store, go to the online store's website and add the second computer to your account, or contact the online store for further assistance.	you copy the protected file from one computer to another and the online store have not issue you new media usage rights -lrb- also know as a license -rrb- for the second computer .#@#in some case , you might be able to resolve the problem by connect to the internet , signing in to you online store , and then attempt to play the file .#@#in other case , you might need to download the file again from the online store , go to the online store 's website and add the second computer to you account , or contact the online store for further assistance . 203	microsoft.txt	1	Why can't I play, burn, or sync protected files that I downloaded from an online store?	The media usage rights that the online store issued to you might restrict the way in which you can use the file. For example, your online store account type might permit you to play files, but not to burn them to audio CDs. If this is the case, you might be able to burn the file to an audio CD if you purchase the file from the online store (as opposed to "renting" the file as part of a monthly subscription account).	the media usage rights that the online store issue to you might restrict the way in which you can use the file .#@#for example , you online store account type might permit you to play file , but not to burn they to audio cd .#@#if this be the case , you might be able to burn the file to a audio cd if you purchase the file from the online store -lrb- as oppose to `` rent '' the file as part of a monthly subscription account -rrb- .	DT NNS NN NNS IN DT JJ NN VBN TO PRP MD VB DT NN IN WDT PRP MD VB DT NN .#@#IN NN , PRP$ JJ NN NN NN MD VB PRP TO VB NNS , CC RB TO VB PRP TO JJ NNS .#@#IN DT VBZ DT NN , PRP MD VB JJ TO VB DT NN TO DT JJ NN IN PRP VBP DT NN IN DT JJ NN -LRB- IN VBN TO `` VBG '' DT NN IN NN IN DT JJ NN NN -RRB- . 203	microsoft.txt	2	Why can't I play, burn, or sync protected files that I downloaded from an online store?	The digital rights management (DRM) components on your computer are out-of-date or are corrupted. In some cases, you might be able resolve the problem by connecting to the Internet, attempting to play a protected file, and then accepting any prompts that appear to update your DRM components.	the digital rights management -lrb- drm -rrb- component on you computer be out-of-date or be corrupt .#@#in some case , you might be able resolve the problem by connect to the internet , attempt to play a protected file , and then accept any prompt that appear to update you drm component . 207	microsoft.txt	2	I installed a font, but I don't see it in the font menu of a program.	There might only be one of the two necessary files in your font folder. Some fonts require that you install two files in the same folder: a bitmap file for the on-screen font, and an outline file for the printer. The bitmap file might be missing. Try contacting the font creator to see if there is a bitmap file you can install. If there isn't a bitmap file, you might try using a different font.	there might only be one of the two necessary file in you font folder .#@#some font require that you install two file in the same folder : a bitmap file for the on-screen font , and a outline file for the printer .#@#the bitmap file might be miss .#@#try contact the font creator to see if there be a bitmap file you can install .#@#if there be not a bitmap file , you might try use a different font . For example, some DVD players only play DVD+R or DVD+RW discs, while others only play DVD-R or DVD-RW discs.	the disc type may not be compatible .#@#some dvd player or dvd-rom drive can only play certain kind of dvd .#@#for example , some dvd player only play dvd+r or dvd+rw disc , while other only play dvd-r or dvd-rw disc . 215	microsoft.txt	10	I can't connect to the Internet through a dial-up connection, or I'm being disconnected.	If your computer has two network connections, the networking software must choose which connection to use for network traffic. The networking software picks the connection with the best performance. If connection A has Internet connectivity but slow performance and connection B has no Internet connectivity but better local network performance, the networking software will route network traffic over connection B. This means that you won't be able to view websites, so the networking icon and the network diagram in Network and Sharing Center will report that you only have local connectivity (no Internet). This is correct, but it's not what you want. To force your computer to use connection Athe connection with Internet connectivitydisconnect connection B and try again.	if you computer have two network connection , the networking software must choose which connection to use for network traffic .#@#the networking software pick the connection with the best performance .#@#if connection a have internet connectivity but slow performance and connection b have no internet connectivity but better local network performance , the networking software will route network traffic over connection b .#@#this mean that you will not be able to view website , so the networking icon and the network diagram in Network and share Center will report that you only have local connectivity -lrb- no internet -rrb- .#@#this be correct , but it be not what you want .#@#to force you computer to use connection a -- the connection with internet connectivity -- disconnect connection b and try again . 218	microsoft.txt	1	The Input Panel tab doesn't appear on the edge of my screen.	The Input Panel tab isn't visible when you run a program in full-screen mode. When running some programs, such as a Remote Desktop session from your Tablet PC, the tab appears when you bring your tablet pen close to the edge of the screen. In other programs, such as some games and movies, the Input Panel tab doesn't appear until you stop running the program in full-screen mode.	the Input Panel tab be not visible when you run a program in full-screen mode .#@#when run some program , such as a remote Desktop session from you Tablet PC , the tab appear when you bring you tablet pen close to the edge of the screen .#@#in other program , such as some game and movie , the Input Panel tab do not appear until you stop run the program in full-screen mode . 220	microsoft.txt	0	I can't send or receive a fax using my fax modem.	If you're using a built-in or an external fax modem, make sure that you've set up Windows Fax and Scan to work with the modem. You can connect to one fax modem only. You should also make sure that your computer (or your external fax modem) is connected to an analog phone line, and that the phone line has a dial tone so that you can place and receive phone or fax calls. 220	microsoft.txt	2	I can't send or receive a fax using my fax modem.	If you've already set up Windows Fax and Scan to work with the modem but you are still unable to send or receive faxes, check the modem settings to see if send and receive options are turned on. To turn on send and receive options for a modem Click the Start button , click All Programs, and then click Windows Fax and Scan. To use Fax view, at the bottom of the left pane, click Fax. Click the Tools menu, and then click Fax Settings. If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation. Click the General tab, and then, under Device name, make sure that the modem is selected. Under Send/receive options, make sure that the Allow the device to send faxes check box is selected. Make sure that the Allow the device to receive fax calls check box is selected, and then choose how to receive faxes: To manually answer phone calls as incoming fax calls using Windows Fax and Scan, click Manually answer, and then click OK. To have Windows automatically answer phone calls as incoming fax calls, click Automatically answer after X rings, select the number of rings after which Windows can try to answer phone calls as incoming fax calls, and then click OK.	if you have already set up Windows Fax and scan to work with the modem but you be still unable to send or receive fax , check the modem setting to see if send and receive option be turn on .#@#to turn on send and receive option for a modem click the Start button , click all program , and then click Windows Fax and scan .#@#to use fax view , at the bottom of the left pane , click fax .#@#click the Tools menu , and then click Fax setting .#@#if you be prompt for a administrator password or confirmation , type the password or provide confirmation .#@#click the General tab , and then , under Device name , make sure that the modem be select .#@#under send/receive option , make sure that the allow the device to send fax check box be select .#@#make sure that the allow the device to receive fax call check box be select , and then choose how to receive fax : to manually answer phone call as incoming fax call use Windows Fax and scan , click manually answer , and then click ok .#@#to have Windows automatically answer phone call as incoming fax call , click automatically answer after x ring , select the number of ring after which Windows can try to answer phone call as incoming fax call , and then click ok . 220	microsoft.txt	3	I can't send or receive a fax using my fax modem.	If someone else set up the computer to send and receive faxes, you might not have permission to use the built-in or external fax modem. To give all users permission to send and receive faxes Click the Start button , click All Programs, and then click Windows Fax and Scan. To use Fax view, at the bottom of the left pane, click Fax. Click the Tools menu, and then click Fax Settings. If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation. Click the Security tab, and then, in the Group or user names box, click Everyone. In the Permissions for Everyone box, select the Allow check box next to the Fax permission, and then click OK.	if someone else set up the computer to send and receive fax , you might not have permission to use the built-in or external fax modem .#@#to give all user permission to send and receive fax click the Start button , click all program , and then click Windows Fax and scan .#@#to use fax view , at the bottom of the left pane , click fax .#@#click the Tools menu , and then click Fax setting .#@#if you be prompt for a administrator password or confirmation , type the password or provide confirmation .#@#click the security tab , and then , in the Group or user name box , click everyone .#@#in the Permissions for everyone box , select the allow check box next to the fax permission , and then click ok . 236	microsoft.txt	0	A computer or device is not placed correctly on the map.	The computer is running Windows Vista and is connected to a network that is assigned to the "Public place" network location. When a computer is on a network assigned to the Public place location, Windows cannot correctly place it on the network map. To fix this problem, you can try changing the network location to "Private" or connecting to a network that is assigned to the "Private" network location. For more information about network locations, see Choosing a network location.	the computer be run Windows Vista and be connect to a network that be assign to the `` Public place '' network location .#@#when a computer be on a network assign to the `` Public place '' location , Windows can not correctly place it on the network map .#@#to fix this problem , you can try change the network location to `` private '' or connect to a network that be assign to the `` private '' network location .#@#for more information about network location , see choose a network location . The device doesn't support the required protocols for Windows Vista, which can cause some devices to appear on the network map, but not as you'd expect to see them. For example, a router could be shown as three things: a router, a switch, and an access point. Check the information that came with the device to see if it has a Windows Vista logo. If the device has the logo, it should appear correctly on the network map. 237	microsoft.txt	1	A computer or device does not appear on the network map.	The computer is running Windows Vista and the Link Layer Topology Discovery (LLTD) protocol is disabled on the network adapter. Windows uses the LLTD protocol to map computers and devices on a network. To enable LLTD, follow these steps: Open Network Connections by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Network and Internet, clicking Network and Sharing Center, and then clicking Manage network connections. Right-click the network adapter icon, and then click Properties. Select the Link-Layer Topology Discovery Mapper I/O Driver and Link-Layer Topology Discovery Responder check boxes, and then click OK.	the computer be run Windows Vista and the Link Layer Topology Discovery -lrb- LLTD -rrb- protocol be disabled on the network adapter .#@#Windows use the lltd protocol to map computer and device on a network .#@#to enable LLTD , follow these step : open Network Connections by click the Start button , click Control Panel , click Network and Internet , click Network and share Center , and then click Manage network connection .#@#right-click the network adapter icon , and then click Properties .#@#Select the Link-Layer Topology Discovery Mapper I/O driver and Link-Layer Topology Discovery responder check box , and then click ok . 237	microsoft.txt	2	A computer or device does not appear on the network map.	The computer is running Windows Vista and network discovery is turned off. To turn on network discovery, follow these steps: Open Network and Sharing Center by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Network and Internet, and then clicking Network and Sharing Center. If network discovery is off, click the arrow button .  to expand the section, click Turn on network discovery, and then click Apply. If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation. For more information about network discovery, see What is network discovery?	the computer be run Windows Vista and network discovery be turn off .#@#to turn on network discovery , follow these step : open Network and share Center by click the Start button , click Control Panel , click Network and Internet , and then click Network and share Center .#@#if network discovery be off , click the arrow button .#@#to expand the section , click turn on network discovery , and then click Apply .#@#if you be prompt for a administrator password or confirmation , type the password or provide confirmation .#@#for more information about network discovery , see what be network discovery ? 237	microsoft.txt	3	A computer or device does not appear on the network map.	The computer is running Windows XP and the LLTD protocol is not installed. Before a computer running Windows XP can be detected and appear on the network map, you need to install the LLTD protocol on that computer. For more information, go to Network Map Does Not Display Computers Running Windows XP on the Microsoft website.	the computer be run Windows xp and the lltd protocol be not install .#@#before a computer run Windows xp can be detect and appear on the network map , you need to install the lltd protocol on that computer .#@#for more information , go to Network Map do not display computer run Windows xp on the Microsoft website . 239	microsoft.txt	4	What happens if the connection to the Windows Media Center computer is lost?	If the Media Center Extender is connected to the Windows Media Center computer using a wireless network connection, make sure the wireless network connection is working properly. Also check and correct the following: Clear obstructions between the Media Center Extender and the access point. If you are not using an 802.11a network, make sure there are no appliances interfering with the connection. Try moving the Media Center Extender or access point to improve the connection between the two devices.	if the Media Center Extender be connect to the Windows Media Center computer use a wireless network connection , make sure the wireless network connection be work properly .#@#also check and correct the following : clear obstruction between the Media Center Extender and the access point .#@#if you be not use a 802.11 a network , make sure there be no appliance interfere with the connection .#@#try move the Media Center Extender or access point to improve the connection between the two device . 240	microsoft.txt	0	Your computer is too far from the wireless router or access point.	With 802.11b or 802.11g routers and access points, the maximum range is up to 150 feet (46 meters) indoors and 300 feet (92 meters) outdoors. With 802.11a routers and access points, the maximum range is 50 feet (15 meters) indoors and 100 feet (30 meters) outdoors. These ranges are in optimal conditions with no interference. Make sure that your computer is within this range and as close as possible to the router or access point. If the computer is portable, try moving it around to determine the range of the wireless signal and the best place to put the computer.	with 802.11 b or 802.11 g router and access point , the maximum range be up to 150 foot -lrb- 46 meter -rrb- indoors and 300 foot -lrb- 92 meter -rrb- outdoors .#@#with 802.11 a router and access point , the maximum range be 50 foot -lrb- 15 meter -rrb- indoors and 100 foot -lrb- 30 meter -rrb- outdoors .#@#these range be in optimal condition with no interference .#@#make sure that you computer be within this range and as close as possible to the router or access point .#@#if the computer be portable , try move it around to determine the range of the wireless signal and the best place to put the computer . 240	microsoft.txt	1	Your computer is too far from the wireless router or access point.	If you are unable to get closer to the router or access point, you might want to consider buying and installing an external antenna to your wireless network adapter. Many wireless network adapters are set up so that you can attach an external antenna to them, which will provide you with better reception than the built-in antenna. Check the information that came with your wireless network adapter to see if you can install an additional antenna.	if you be unable to get closer to the router or access point , you might want to consider buy and install a external antenna to you wireless network adapter .#@#many wireless network adapter be set up so that you can attach a external antenna to they , which will provide you with better reception than the built-in antenna .#@#check the information that come with you wireless network adapter to see if you can install a additional antenna . 242	microsoft.txt	1	There is interference from other devices.	Change the router or access point settings to use a different wireless channel, or set the channel to be selected automatically if it is set to a fixed channel number. Sometimes one wireless channel is clearer than others. In the United States and Canada, you can use channels 1, 6, and 11. Check the information that came with your access point or router for instructions about setting the wireless signal channel. If the security program does not include a setting that resolves connection issues, you'll need to uninstall the program to use an Extender.	if you be use a fingerprint reader or another security program on you computer , you might need to change the program 's setting before a extender can be connect to the computer .#@#if the security program do not include a setting that resolve connection issue , you 'll need to uninstall the program to use a extender . 243	microsoft.txt	5	What if a Windows Media Center Extender cannot connect to a Windows Media Center computer?	If you are using a wired connection, make sure that the Ethernet cable is plugged into the Ethernet port on the Media Center Extender. You can try to determine where the problem is occurring by connecting your Xbox 360 directly to your Windows Media Center computer by using a regular Ethernet cable. If Xbox 360 can connect to your Windows Media Center computer, then the problem might be occurring with the router, hub, or switch and the settings on them. However, if your Xbox 360 and computer still cannot connect, the problem might be associated with a setting on your router, hub, or switch alone or in conjunction with a firewall setting. For more information about connecting your Xbox 360 directly to your computer and for information about troubleshooting connection issues by using this method, go to the Connection Issues article on the Microsoft website.	if you be use a wire connection , make sure that the Ethernet cable be plug into the Ethernet port on the Media Center Extender .#@#you can try to determine where the problem be occur by connect you xbox 360 directly to you Windows Media Center computer by use a regular Ethernet cable .#@#if xbox 360 can connect to you Windows Media Center computer , then the problem might be occur with the router , hub , or switch and the setting on they .#@#however , if you xbox 360 and computer still can not connect , the problem might be associate with a setting on you router , hub , or switch alone or in conjunction with a firewall setting .#@#for more information about connect you xbox 360 directly to you computer and for information about troubleshoot connection issue by use this method , go to the connection issue article on the Microsoft website . 243	microsoft.txt	6	What if a Windows Media Center Extender cannot connect to a Windows Media Center computer?	Make sure that your Windows Media Center computer is not joined to a domain. Some network domain policies might be set that prevent Xbox 360 from connecting to a Windows Media Center computer as a Media Center Extender device. If your computer is connected to a domain, remove the computer from the domain, and then go through Extender Setup again.	make sure that you Windows Media Center computer be not join to a domain .#@#some network domain policy might be set that prevent xbox 360 from connect to a Windows Media Center computer as a Media Center Extender device .#@#if you computer be connect to a domain , remove the computer from the domain , and then go through Extender Setup again . 243	microsoft.txt	7	What if a Windows Media Center Extender cannot connect to a Windows Media Center computer?	Make sure that both the Windows Media Center computer and Extender are connected to the same router. This ensures that Xbox 360 and the Windows Media Center computer are connected to the same network. If Xbox 360 connects to your home network using a wireless router, plug one end of an Ethernet cable into an Ethernet port on your Windows Media Center computer and plug the other end of the cable into an Ethernet port on the wireless router.	make sure that both the Windows Media Center computer and extender be connect to the same router .#@#this ensure that xbox 360 and the Windows Media Center computer be connect to the same network .#@#if xbox 360 connect to you home network use a wireless router , plug one end of a Ethernet cable into a ethernet port on you Windows Media Center computer and plug the other end of the cable into a ethernet port on the wireless router . 244	microsoft.txt	2	I get a message saying there is a problem copying files.	If your computer has multiple CD or DVD drives, your computer might be trying to locate files on the wrong drive. If your computer has a feature to disable CD or DVD drives that are not being used, disable the drives that you aren't using. Otherwise, try inserting the disc into a different drive, and then start the installation again.	if you computer have multiple cd or dvd drive , you computer might be try to locate file on the wrong drive .#@#if you computer have a feature to disable CD or dvd drive that be not be use , disable the drive that you be not use .#@#otherwise , try insert the disc into a different drive , and then start the installation again . 247	microsoft.txt	1	Why cant I find a recording?	The recorded show is located in a folder that is unavailable and different from the folder set up for recording. Make sure that the folder that contains the recording is available and can be accessed from your computer. Also, you can change the default folder to store recorded TV shows by doing the following: On the start screen, scroll to Tasks, click settings, click TV, click Recorder, and then click Recorder Storage. Click either the - or + button next to the Record on drive option to choose a new drive. Click Save, and then go to the recorded tv screen and check for your show again.	the record show be located in a folder that be unavailable and different from the folder set up for recording .#@#make sure that the folder that contain the recording be available and can be access from you computer .#@#also , you can change the default folder to store record tv show by do the following : on the start screen , scroll to task , click setting , click tv , click recorder , and then click Recorder Storage .#@#click either the - or + button next to the Record on drive option to choose a new drive .#@#click Save , and then go to the record tv screen and check for you show again . 247	microsoft.txt	2	Why cant I find a recording?	If you still cannot locate your recorded TV show, you can search the Recorded TV folder (the default location is C:\Users\Public\Recorded TV). If you have your recordings stored on an external drive, the folder location might be different (for example, G:\Recorded TV).	if you still can not locate you recorded tv show , you can search the record tv folder -lrb- the default location be c : \ user \ Public \ record tv -rrb- .#@#if you have you recording store on a external drive , the folder location might be different -lrb- for example , g : \ record tv -rrb- . 248	microsoft.txt	0	Why did the wrong channel record?	The IR control cable is positioned incorrectly on the front of the set-top box or is not connected, and Windows Media Center cannot send a signal to the set-top box to change a channel.	the ir control cable be positioned incorrectly on the front of the set-top box or be not connect , and Windows Media Center can not send a signal to the set-top box to change a channel . 248	microsoft.txt	1	Why did the wrong channel record?	The set-top box TV channel changing speed may have been configured incorrectly. For example, if an incorrect channel changing speed is selected, the set-top box might get the signal for only two out of three channels numbers transmitted by Windows Media Center and change a two-digit channel instead of a three-digit channel. You can set up your TV signal again and select a different channel changing speed. To change the channel changing speed On the start screen, scroll to Tasks, click settings, click TV, click Set Up TV Signal, and then continue through the wizard.	the set-top box tv channel change speed may have be configure incorrectly .#@#for example , if a incorrect channel change speed be select , the set-top box might get the signal for only two out of three channel number transmit by Windows Media Center and change a two-digit channel instead of a three-digit channel .#@#you can set up you tv signal again and select a different channel change speed .#@#to change the channel change speed on the start screen , scroll to task , click setting , click tv , click set up tv signal , and then continue through the wizard . 248	microsoft.txt	2	Why did the wrong channel record?	Windows Media Center might have attempted to tune to a channel that is not part of your TV service package. In some cases, the automatic behavior of some set-top boxes affects how Windows Media Center can control the set-top box. When Windows Media Center tunes to a channel that is not part of your TV service package, the set-top box might instead change to a default channel, display an on-screen message, remain on the last viewed channel, or change to the closest viewable channel in the listings. In all cases, the set-top box performs a default action that causes Windows Media Center to get out of sync and record the wrong channel. You can prevent Windows Media Center from trying to access and record channels that you do not subscribe to by hiding unwanted channels. To hide channels that are not included in your TV service package On the start screen, scroll to Tasks, click settings, click TV, click Guide, and then click Edit Channels. Use the arrow buttons on the screen to scroll through the list and locate the channels that you want to show or hide. As you click each channel, the inset window displays that channel. Select or clear the check box next to each channel. When a check box is selected, the channel appears in the Guide; when a check box is cleared, the channel does not appear. Click Save to return to the Guide settings screen.	Windows Media Center might have attempt to tune to a channel that be not part of you tv service package .#@#in some case , the automatic behavior of some set-top box affect how Windows Media Center can control the set-top box .#@#when Windows Media Center tune to a channel that be not part of you tv service package , the set-top box might instead change to a default channel , display a on-screen message , remain on the last view channel , or change to the closest viewable channel in the listing .#@#in all case , the set-top box perform a default action that cause Windows Media Center to get out of sync and record the wrong channel .#@#you can prevent Windows Media Center from try to access and record channel that you do not subscribe to by hide unwanted channel .#@#to hide channel that be not include in you tv service package on the start screen , scroll to task , click setting , click tv , click Guide , and then click Edit Channels .#@#use the arrow button on the screen to scroll through the list and locate the channel that you want to show or hide .#@#as you click each channel , the inset window display that channel .#@#Select or clear the check box next to each channel .#@#when a check box be select , the channel appear in the Guide ; when a check box be clear , the channel do not appear .#@#click save to return to the Guide setting screen . 249	microsoft.txt	0	I tried to log on, but I keep getting a message telling me that the user name or password is incorrect.	CAPS LOCK might be on. Passwords in Windows are case-sensitive, which means that every time you type your password, you have to capitalize each letter in exactly the same way that you did when you first created it. If you have accidentally pressed CAPS LOCK, then you're inadvertently typing your password in all capital letters. Make sure CAPS LOCK is off, and then type your password again.	cap lock might be on .#@#Passwords in Windows be case-sensitive , which mean that every time you type you password , you have to capitalize each letter in exactly the same way that you do when you first create it .#@#if you have accidentally press cap lock , then you be inadvertently typing you password in all capital letter .#@#make sure cap lock be off , and then type you password again . (ROOT (S (NP (NNS CAPS)) (VP (VBP LOCK) (SBAR (S (VP (MD might) (VP (VB be) (PP (IN on))))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (NP (NP (NNPS Passwords)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NNP Windows)))) (VP (VBP are) (ADJP (JJ case-sensitive)) (, ,) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT which)) (S (VP (VBZ means) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (NP (DT every) (NN time)) (NP (PRP you) (NN type)) (NP (NP (PRP$ your) (NN password)) (, ,) (NP (PRP you)))) (VP (VBP have) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB capitalize) (NP (DT each) (NN letter)) (PP (IN in) (NP (RB exactly) (DT the) (JJ same) (NN way))) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (PRP you)) (VP (VBD did) (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB when)) (S (NP (PRP you)) (ADVP (RB first)) (VP (VBD created) (NP (PRP it)))))))))))))))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (SBAR (IN If) (S (NP (PRP you)) (VP (VBP have) (ADVP (RB accidentally)) (VP (VBN pressed) (SBAR (S (NP (NNS CAPS)) (VP (VBP LOCK)))))))) (, ,) (ADVP (RB then)) (NP (PRP you)) (VP (VBP 're) (ADVP (RB inadvertently)) (NP (NP (NN typing) (PRP$ your) (NN password)) (PP (IN in) (NP (DT all) (NN capital) (NNS letters))))) (. .)))#@#(ROOT (S (S (VP (VB Make) (ADJP (JJ sure) (SBAR (S (NP (NNS CAPS)) (VP (VBP LOCK))))))) (VP (VBZ is) (ADVP (ADVP (RB off)) (, ,) (CC and) (ADVP (RB then))) (NP (NP (NN type) (PRP$ your) (NN password)) (ADVP (RB again)))) (. .)))	cap lock might be on passwords in windows be case-sensitive which mean that every time you type you password you have to capitalize each letter in exactly the same way that you do when you first create it if you have accidentally press cap lock then you be inadvertently typing you password in all capital letter make sure cap lock be off and then type you password again

249	microsoft.txt	2	I tried to log on, but I keep getting a message telling me that the user name or password is incorrect.	An administrator on the computer might have reset your password. If your computer is on a network, a network administrator has the ability to reset your password. If you think this might be the problem, check with your network administrator. If your computer is in a workgroup, anyone who has an administrator account on the computer can change your password.	a administrator on the computer might have reset you password .#@#if you computer be on a network , a network administrator have the ability to reset you password .#@#if you think this might be the problem , check with you network administrator .#@#if you computer be in a workgroup , anyone who have a administrator account on the computer can change you password . 250	microsoft.txt	2	I can't hear any text read aloud.	Make sure that your sound card is properly installed and the drivers are updated. To check for a sound card Open Audio Devices and Sound Themes by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Hardware and Sound, and then clicking Sound. Your sound card is listed on the Playback tab. If you don't have a sound card installed, you'll have to get one for Narrator to work. To determine if the sound card is working You must be logged on as an administrator to perform these steps. Open Device Manager by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking System and Maintenance, and then clicking Device Manager. .  If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation. If the sound card has a yellow question mark next to it, the sound card might not be working. Try reinstalling the sound card driver. For more information, see Update a driver for hardware that isn't working properly. If the sound card appears twice in the list, you might have a ghost device. If so, delete the list entry with the question mark.	make sure that you sound card be properly install and the driver be update .#@#to check for a sound card open Audio Devices and Sound theme by click the Start button , click Control Panel , click hardware and sound , and then click sound .#@#you sound card be list on the Playback tab .#@#if you do not have a sound card install , you 'll have to get one for narrator to work .#@#to determine if the sound card be work you must be log on as a administrator to perform these step .#@#open Device Manager by click the Start button , click Control Panel , click System and Maintenance , and then click Device Manager .#@#.#@#if you be prompt for a administrator password or confirmation , type the password or provide confirmation .#@#if the sound card have a yellow question mark next to it , the sound card might not be work .#@#try reinstall the sound card driver .#@#for more information , see Update a driver for hardware that be not work properly .#@#if the sound card appear twice in the list , you might have a ghost device .#@#if so , delete the list entry with the question mark . 256	microsoft.txt	0	Why can't Windows Media Center change channels?	The infrared remote control cable, also known as an IR blaster, might not be connected. If it is connected, it might be positioned incorrectly on the front of the set-top box. If the IR blaster is not connected or positioned correctly, Windows Media Center cannot send a signal to the set-top box to change a channel.	the infrared remote control cable , also know as a IR blaster , might not be connect .#@#if it be connect , it might be position incorrectly on the front of the set-top box .#@#if the IR blaster be not connect or position correctly , Windows Media Center can not send a signal to the set-top box to change a channel . 259	microsoft.txt	0	Why can't I get a signal for a specific digital antenna TV channel?	The antenna placement or location is such that strong, consistent over-the-air digital TV signals cannot be received. Try repositioning the antenna for better TV signal reception, then check the signal strength in Windows Media Center. To check TV signal strength for digital TV channels, on the start screen, scroll to Tasks, click settings, click TV, and then click Digital TV Antenna Signal Strength. If you live in Europe and have an antenna that supports Digital Video Broadcast-Terrestrial (DVB-T) channels, the scan by Windows Media Center might have identified channels that you do not receive. You can remove these channels from the Windows Media Center Guide interface by doing the following: On the start menu, scroll to Tasks, click settings, click TV, click Guide, and then click Edit Channels.	if you live in Europe and have a antenna that support Digital Video Broadcast-Terrestrial -lrb- dvb-t -rrb- channel , the scan by Windows Media Center might have identify channel that you do not receive .#@#you can remove these channel from the Windows Media Center Guide interface by do the following : on the start menu , scroll to task , click setting , click tv , click Guide , and then click Edit Channels . 261	microsoft.txt	1	I get an "Access is Denied" error when I try to print to a shared printer on my home network.	If the other computers on your network can "see" the Windows XP computer and its attached printer, can share files with that computer, but still encounter an "Access is Denied" error when trying to print, try the following workaround: Open Printers by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Hardware and Sound, and then clicking Printers. Click Add a printer. In the Add Printer wizard, click Add a local printer. Click Create a new port. Make sure Local Port is selected in the list, and then click Next. In the Port Name dialog box, type \\computer name\printer name, and then click OK. Complete the rest of the wizard, and then click Finish.	if the other computer on you network can `` see '' the Windows xp computer and its attach printer , can share file with that computer , but still encounter a `` access be deny '' error when try to print , try the follow workaround : open printer by click the Start button , click Control Panel , click hardware and sound , and then click printer .#@#click add a printer .#@#in the add printer wizard , click add a local printer .#@#click create a new port .#@#make sure local Port be select in the list , and then click next .#@#in the Port name dialog box , type \ \ computer name \ printer name , and then click ok .#@#complete the rest of the wizard , and then click finish . 262	microsoft.txt	2	I can't find a printer that I want to add in the Network folder.	If you don't know the name or network address (a location on the network) of the printer, contact the person who installed the printer on the network or a system administrator. If your computer is connected to a network domain, you might not have permission to use some printers and the printers will not be displayed. To obtain permission, contact a system administrator.	if you do not know the name or network address -lrb- a location on the network -rrb- of the printer , contact the person who install the printer on the network or a system administrator .#@#if you computer be connect to a network domain , you might not have permission to use some printer and the printer will not be display .#@#to obtain permission , contact a system administrator . 264	microsoft.txt	3	I can't print to a network printer.	If you are trying to print to a printer that you added using a TCP/IP address instead of a printer name, make sure that your computer is connected to the Internet or the network where the printer is installed. If you recently experienced a power outage, the printer TCP/IP address might have changed. The new address will not work with the printer port that you used to connect the printer to your computer. Try to add the printer again. For more information, see Add or remove a printer.	if you be try to print to a printer that you add use a tcp/ip address instead of a printer name , make sure that you computer be connect to the internet or the network where the printer be install .#@#if you recently experience a power outage , the printer tcp/ip address might have change .#@#the new address will not work with the printer port that you use to connect the printer to you computer .#@#try to add the printer again .#@#for more information , see add or remove a printer . If you are not sure what the correct proxy server or firewall settings are, you might need to contact either your network administrator or your Internet service provider (ISP). 267	microsoft.txt	1	I don't see any computers or devices in the Network folder.	Network discovery is blocking you from seeing other computers and devices. If the network discovery setting on your computer is set to Off, you won't see other computers and devices on the network. To change your network discovery setting, follow these steps: Open Network and Sharing Center by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Network and Internet, and then clicking Network and Sharing Center. If network discovery is off, click the arrow button .  to expand the section, click Turn on network discovery, and then click Apply. If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation. 268	microsoft.txt	0	I don't see a computer or device that I expect to see in the Network folder.	The computer or device isn't on the network. To solve this problem, add the computer to the network by plugging it into the hub, switch, or router (if the network is Ethernet), or by connecting to the network using the Connect to a Network wizard (if the network is wireless). If you think the computer has been added to the network but there is a problem, you can run Network Diagnostics on the computer to try to find the problem. To run Network Diagnostics, in the notification area, right-click the network icon, and then click Diagnose and repair.	the computer or device be not on the network .#@#to solve this problem , add the computer to the network by plug it into the hub , switch , or router -lrb- if the network be ethernet -rrb- , or by connect to the network use the connect to a Network wizard -lrb- if the network be wireless -rrb- .#@#if you think the computer have be add to the network but there be a problem , you can run Network Diagnostics on the computer to try to find the problem .#@#to run Network Diagnostics , in the notification area , right-click the network icon , and then click diagnose and repair . 268	microsoft.txt	1	I don't see a computer or device that I expect to see in the Network folder.	The computer's network discovery setting is set to Off, which prevents you from seeing it. To change the network discovery setting on another computer, log on to the computer, click the Start button , click Control Panel, click Network and Internet, and then click Network and Sharing Center. Click the arrow button .  to expand the Network Discovery section, click Turn on network discovery, and then click Apply. If you don't own or have access to the computer, ask the person who owns it to change the network discovery setting to On so you can see the computer in the Network folder.	the computer 's network discovery setting be set to off , which prevent you from see it .#@#to change the network discovery setting on another computer , log on to the computer , click the Start button , click control panel , click Network and Internet , and then click Network and share Center .#@#click the arrow button .#@#to expand the Network Discovery section , click turn on network discovery , and then click Apply .#@#if you do not own or have access to the computer , ask the person who own it to change the network discovery set to on so you can see the computer in the Network folder . 269	microsoft.txt	1	Why doesn't my FM radio play?	The cable connections for FM radio are not connected properly to the tuner hardware or the antenna is not positioned optimally. Make sure that the cable or radio antenna is attached to the FM radio connector on the tuner and properly positioned for the best signal reception. If you have two tuners that support FM radio, be sure each tuner is connected to its own FM radio signal source. Windows Media Center uses available tuners as needed and, if you have an FM radio antenna connected to only one tuner, you cannot get radio when that tuner is already in use for TV. Refer to your hardware documentation for the preferred hardware arrangement.	the cable connection for FM radio be not connect properly to the tuner hardware or the antenna be not positioned optimally .#@#make sure that the cable or radio antenna be attach to the FM radio connector on the tuner and properly position for the best signal reception .#@#if you have two tuner that support fm radio , be sure each tuner be connect to its own FM radio signal source .#@#Windows Media Center use available tuner as need and , if you have a fm radio antenna connect to only one tuner , you can not get radio when that tuner be already in use for tv .#@#refer to you hardware documentation for the preferred hardware arrangement . 269	microsoft.txt	3	Why doesn't my FM radio play?	Your computer has a tuner installed, but it has not been configured for use with Windows Media Center. To configure it for use with Windows Media Center, do the following: On the start screen, scroll to Tasks, click settings, click General, click Windows Media Center Setup, and then click Set Up TV Signal. Follow the steps on the screen to configure your tuner. The radio option should appear after you have configured your tuner.	you computer have a tuner install , but it have not be configure for use with Windows Media Center .#@#to configure it for use with Windows Media Center , do the following : on the start screen , scroll to task , click setting , click General , click Windows Media Center Setup , and then click set up tv signal .#@#follow the step on the screen to configure you tuner .#@#the radio option should appear after you have configure you tuner . 270	microsoft.txt	0	Why are no FM radio stations detected?	Windows Media Center cannot find, or seek, a radio frequency that has a weak signal. If you manually enter the frequency or tune directly to a station with a weak signal, Windows Media Center plays the station. However, if you use Seek mode, Windows Media Center might bypass a weak signal.
