271	microsoft.txt	0	Why did the FM radio stop playing unexpectedly?	Tuner hardware that may be included in your computer can have an FM radio input as well as an input for TV signal. In some cases, that type of tuner hardware cannot receive FM radio at the same time as it receives a TV signal. For example, if the tuner is in use for FM radio when Windows Media Center is scheduled to start a recording, a warning appears that the FM radio session will be stopped when the TV recording starts. If you do not make a selection, Windows Media Center automatically stops FM radio and begins recording TV, as scheduled. If that does not solve the problem, and this is the first time youve tried to copy pictures from the camera to the computer, its possible that your camera needs a special driver to copy pictures. If you are recording your published movie to tape and you have multiple partitions on your hard disk, and if one partition is formatted using the NTFS file system, you can use that partition as your temporary storage location. To change the temporary storage location, do the following: Click Tools, and then click Options. In the Temporary Storage box, choose the drive that is formatted using the NTFS file system.	if you be record you publish movie to tape and you have multiple partition on you hard disk , and if one partition be format use the ntf file system , you can use that partition as you temporary storage location .#@#to change the temporary storage location , do the following : click tool , and then click option .#@#in the Temporary Storage box , choose the drive that be format use the ntf file system . 290	microsoft.txt	1	I added my scanner to the computer but I can't select it when I use Windows Fax and Scan or Windows Photo Gallery.	If a driver is not available or if you've updated the driver and still can't select the scanner, find out if your scanner uses TWAIN technology. TWAIN is an application programming interface (API) that is used to import images from scanners and digital cameras to your computer. Windows Photo Gallery and Windows Fax and Scan use a different technology, called the Windows Image Acquisition (WIA) API, and do not work with TWAIN scanners. If your scanner uses TWAIN technology, you might need to use the program that came with your scanner instead of using Windows Fax and Scan or Windows Photo Gallery. To find out if your scanner uses TWAIN technology, check the information that came with the scanner or contact the scanner manufacturer.	if a driver be not available or if you have update the driver and still can not select the scanner , find out if you scanner use TWAIN technology .#@#twain be a application programming interface -lrb- apus -rrb- that be use to import image from scanner and digital camera to you computer .#@#Windows Photo Gallery and Windows Fax and scan use a different technology , call the Windows image acquisition -lrb- wium -rrb- apus , and do not work with twain scanner .#@#if you scanner use TWAIN technology , you might need to use the program that come with you scanner instead of use Windows Fax and scan or Windows Photo Gallery .#@#to find out if you scanner use TWAIN technology , check the information that come with the scanner or contact the scanner manufacturer . 293	microsoft.txt	2	Keyboard is not functioning correctly	Incorrect keyboard layout settings. For more information, see: Change your keyboard layout in Windows 7 Change your keyboard layout in Windows Vista To change your keyboard layout in Windows XP, follow these steps: Click Start, and then click Control Panel. Click Date, Time, Language, and Regional Options. Click Add other languages. Click the Languages tab, and then click Details. Click the Settings tab, and then click Add. Click the Input language list, and then select your preferred language and dialect. If you want to change the standard keyboard layout, click the Keyboard layout/IME list, select a new keyboard layout, and then click OK. On the Settings tab, click the Default input language list, and select the language you'll use most often. The language you select as the default will display when you first start your PC. To add additional languages, go back to step 5, or, if you have finished adding languages, click OK.	incorrect keyboard layout setting .#@#for more information , see : Change you keyboard layout in Windows 7 Change you keyboard layout in Windows Vista to change you keyboard layout in Windows xp , follow these step : click Start , and then click control panel .#@#click Date , Time , Language , and Regional Options .#@#click add other language .#@#click the Languages tab , and then click detail .#@#click the setting tab , and then click add .#@#click the Input language list , and then select you preferred language and dialect .#@#if you want to change the standard keyboard layout , click the keyboard layout/ime list , select a new keyboard layout , and then click ok .#@#on the setting tab , click the Default input language list , and select the language you 'll use most often .#@#the language you select as the default will display when you first start you pc .#@#to add additional language , go back to step 5 , or , if you have finish add language , click ok . 294	microsoft.txt	2	Problems with touchpad	The sensitivity of the touchpad is set too high. If the sensitivity is set to high on the touchpad, any slight touch can cause the cursor to randomly jump to another location of the screen. To resolve this issue, lower the sensitivity setting of the touchpad using the touchpad settings.	the sensitivity of the touchpad be set too high .#@#if the sensitivity be set to high on the touchpad , any slight touch can cause the cursor to randomly jump to another location of the screen .#@#to resolve this issue , lower the sensitivity setting of the touchpad use the touchpad setting . 295	microsoft.txt	0	Problems with mouse	Dirt. There might be dirt or a buildup on the bottom of the mouse around the opening for the sensor. Clean any dirt or buildup from the bottom of the mouse and from the opening for the sensor. For an older mouse that uses a mouse ball, you can unplug the mouse, turn the mouse over, and twist the bottom cover off. Remove and clean the mouse ball. If necessary, you can use compressed air to blow any lint from the inside of the mouse. Replace the mouse ball and cover. If your mouse uses a PS2 connection, you might need to restart the PC to reload the driver for the mouse.	dirt .#@#there might be dirt or a buildup on the bottom of the mouse around the opening for the sensor .#@#clean any dirt or buildup from the bottom of the mouse and from the opening for the sensor .#@#for a older mouse that use a mouse ball , you can unplug the mouse , turn the mouse over , and twist the bottom cover off .#@#remove and clean the mouse ball .#@#if necessary , you can use compress air to blow any lint from the inside of the mouse .#@#replace the mouse ball and cover .#@#if you mouse use a ps2 connection , you might need to restart the pc to reload the driver for the mouse . 295	microsoft.txt	2	Problems with mouse	Improper surface. When using a laser mouse, the surface should have enough of a pattern for the mouse sensor to detect movement. On a surface such as glass or a mirrored surface, the mouse sensor doesnt have enough of a pattern to detect movement, so the mouse won't move the cursor (or the cursor might move very erratically).	improper surface .#@#when use a laser mouse , the surface should have enough of a pattern for the mouse sensor to detect movement .#@#on a surface such as glass or a mirror surface , the mouse sensor do not have enough of a pattern to detect movement , so the mouse will not move the cursor -lrb- or the cursor might move very erratically -rrb- . 296	microsoft.txt	2	Error 678 message	You might be dialing the wrong number, or a long-distance code or access code might have been added to the phone number. Check the modem log to see what number is actually being dialed. Here's how to view the log: Open Phone and Modem Options by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Hardware and Sound, and then clicking Phone and Modem Options. If you haven't opened Phone and Modem Options before, a dialog box will appear, prompting you to type your area code and access codes. Click the Modems tab, select your modem from the list, and then click Properties. Click the Diagnostics tab, and then click View log. If you need to change the phone number or add or remove codes, in Phone and Modem Options, on the Dialing Rules tab, click Edit.	you might be dial the wrong number , or a long-distance code or access code might have be add to the phone number .#@#check the modem log to see what number be actually be dial .#@#here be how to view the log : open Phone and Modem Options by click the Start button , click Control Panel , click hardware and sound , and then click Phone and Modem Options .#@#if you have not open Phone and Modem Options before , a dialog box will appear , prompt you to type you area code and access code .#@#click the modem tab , select you modem from the list , and then click Properties .#@#click the Diagnostics tab , and then click View log .#@#if you need to change the phone number or add or remove code , in Phone and Modem Options , on the Dialing Rules tab , click Edit . 296	microsoft.txt	3	Error 678 message	Your modem might not be able to connect with the modem at the other end before the allotted time is up. If you hear the modem connection noise but this message still appears, try increasing the allotted time before a call is canceled or decreasing the port speed. Here's how to do that: Open Phone and Modem Options by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Hardware and Sound, and then clicking Phone and Modem Options. If you haven't opened Phone and Modem Options before, a dialog box will appear, prompting you to type your area code and access codes. Click the Modems tab, select your modem from the list, and then click Properties. Click the Advanced tab, and then click Change Default Preferences. Increase the number of seconds before a call is canceled, decrease the port speed, or make both changes.	you modem might not be able to connect with the modem at the other end before the allotted time be up .#@#if you hear the modem connection noise but this message still appear , try increase the allotted time before a call be cancel or decrease the port speed .#@#here be how to do that : open Phone and Modem Options by click the Start button , click Control Panel , click hardware and sound , and then click Phone and Modem Options .#@#if you have not open Phone and Modem Options before , a dialog box will appear , prompt you to type you area code and access code .#@#click the modem tab , select you modem from the list , and then click Properties .#@#click the Advanced tab , and then click Change Default Preferences .#@#increase the number of seconds before a call be cancel , decrease the port speed , or make both change . 297	microsoft.txt	1	Why is my screen black when I start Windows 7?	Double-click Display adapters, right-click your display device, click Update Driver Software, and then follow the steps in the wizard that appears. After the driver is reinstalled, you might need to restart your computer again to complete the installation. You might also need to adjust the screen resolution to its previous setting. 297	microsoft.txt	2	Why is my screen black when I start Windows 7?	Check for registry issues Right-click the taskbar, and then click Start Task Manager. Click the Processes tab, click explorer.exe, and then click End Process. Click File, and then click New Task (Run) In the Open text box, enter explorer.exe, and then click OK. Click the Start button , enter regedit in the search box, and then, in the search results, click regedit.exe Browse to the following registry key: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon Click to select the WinLogon key, and then, in the right pane, click Shell. The value of Shell in the Data column should be explorer.exe. If the value of Shell isn't explorer.exe, double-click Shell, and then, in the Value data text field, enter explorer.exe, and then click OK. Close the registry editor, and then restart your PC.	check for registry issue right-click the taskbar , and then click Start Task Manager .#@#click the Processes tab , click explorer.exe , and then click end process .#@#click File , and then click new Task -lrb- Run -rrb- in the Open text box , enter explorer.exe , and then click ok .#@#click the Start button , enter regedit in the search box , and then , in the search result , click regedit.exe browse to the follow registry key : hkey_local_machine \ SOFTWARE \ Microsoft \ Windows NT \ CurrentVersion \ Winlogon click to select the WinLogon key , and then , in the right pane , click Shell .#@#the value of Shell in the datum column should be explorer.exe .#@#if the value of Shell be not explorer.exe , double-click Shell , and then , in the Value datum text field , enter explorer.exe , and then click ok .#@#close the registry editor , and then restart you pc . 297	microsoft.txt	3	Why is my screen black when I start Windows 7?	Start the computer in safe mode and run System Restore Click the Start button , click the arrow next to Shut Down, and then click Restart. Do one of the following: If your computer has a single operating system installed, press and hold the F8 key as your computer restarts. You must press F8 before the Windows logo appears. If the Windows logo appears, try again by waiting until the Windows logon prompt appears, and then shutting down and restarting your computer. If your computer has more than one operating system, use the arrow keys to highlight the operating system you want to start in safe mode, and then press F8. On the Advanced Boot Options screen, use the arrow keys to highlight Safe Mode, and then press Enter. Log on to your computer with a user account that has administrator rights. When your computer is in safe mode, you'll see the words Safe Mode in the corners of your monitor. Click the Start button , type "system restore" in the search box, click System Restore, and then click Next If you're prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation. Choose a restore point when your PC worked as expected, click Next, and then click Finish. Restart your computer normally.	Start the computer in safe mode and run System restore click the Start button , click the arrow next to shut down , and then click Restart .#@#do one of the following : if you computer have a single operating system install , press and hold the f8 key as you computer restart .#@#you must press f8 before the Windows logo appear .#@#if the Windows logo appear , try again by wait until the Windows logon prompt appear , and then shut down and restart you computer .#@#if you computer have more than one operating system , use the arrow key to highlight the operating system you want to start in safe mode , and then press f8 .#@#on the Advanced Boot Options screen , use the arrow key to highlight Safe Mode , and then press enter .#@#log on to you computer with a user account that have administrator rights .#@#when you computer be in safe mode , you 'll see the word Safe Mode in the corner of you monitor .#@#click the Start button , type `` system restore '' in the search box , click System Restore , and then click next if you be prompt for a administrator password or confirmation , type the password or provide confirmation .#@#choose a restore point when you pc work as expect , click next , and then click finish .#@#restart you computer normally . 297	microsoft.txt	4	Why is my screen black when I start Windows 7?	If these steps solve the problem, you're done. If not, try repeating the steps and selecting an older restore point (if one is available). If that still doesn't solve the problem, contact your computer manufacturer or technical support for further assistance.	if these step solve the problem , you be do .#@#if not , try repeat the step and select a older restore point -lrb- if one be available -rrb- .#@#if that still do not solve the problem , contact you computer manufacturer or technical support for further assistance . 298	microsoft.txt	0	Why doesnt my CD or DVD drive work?	The drive may have stopped working because something on your computer changed. Installing or uninstalling software on your computer, or upgrading your Windows operating system, can sometimes cause the CD or DVD drive to stop working. This is usually because something happened during the installation that caused a problem with the CD or DVD filter drivers. If the drive stopped working after you installed new software or made other changes to your computer, you can try turning it on again. To turn on your drive: Open the DVD drive properties by clicking the Start button .  , clicking Computer, right-clicking the DVD drive, and then clicking Properties. Click the Hardware tab, and then click the DVD drive. Under Device Properties, click Properties, click the Driver tab, click Enable, and then click OK. For more help, see the Knowledge Base article The CD drive or the DVD drive does not work as expected on a computer that you upgraded to Windows Vista.	the drive may have stop work because something on you computer change .#@#install or uninstall software on you computer , or upgrade you Windows operating system , can sometimes cause the CD or dvd drive to stop work .#@#this be usually because something happen during the installation that cause a problem with the CD or dvd filter driver .#@#if the drive stop work after you install new software or make other change to you computer , you can try turn it on again .#@#to turn on you drive : open the dvd drive property by click the Start button .#@#, click computer , right-click the dvd drive , and then click Properties .#@#click the Hardware tab , and then click the dvd drive .#@#under Device Properties , click Properties , click the driver tab , click enable , and then click ok .#@#for more help , see the Knowledge Base article the CD drive or the dvd drive do not work as expect on a computer that you upgrade to Windows Vista . 298	microsoft.txt	3	Why doesnt my CD or DVD drive work?	You might need a new driver for your CD or DVD drive. CD and DVD drives, like other hardware, need drivers to communicate with the computer. If the drive isn't working, you might need a new or updated driver that's compatible with your version of Windows, even if you installed a new drive recently or if it came with your computer. For help updating the driver, see Update a driver for hardware that isn't working properly, and Finding drivers: What to do when your hardware won't work with Windows Vista.	you might need a new driver for you cd or dvd drive .#@#CD and dvd drive , like other hardware , need driver to communicate with the computer .#@#if the drive be not work , you might need a new or update driver that be compatible with you version of Windows , even if you install a new drive recently or if it come with you computer .#@#for help update the driver , see Update a driver for hardware that be not work properly , and Finding driver : what to do when you hardware will not work with Windows Vista . 299	microsoft.txt	4	Windows Media Player error C00D11BA	Make sure you have a sound device installed on your computer. If not, install a sound device (such as a sound card), and then try to play the file again.
